194: Review: Sono stata ieri sera a cena con la mia famiglia, abbiamo mangiato un’ottima tagliata di carne. Carne italiana dal Piemonte, vino buono e personale molto gentile e ben preparato. Anche i dolci molto buoni. Rapporto qualità/prezzo giusto. Da ritornare!!
195: Review: Food was good. However, the portion would actually be too small for a six year old child. Pasta is 90g/per person. Missing the Italian generosity. The price nevertheless is very generous !!! We don’t recommend it and won’t come back.
196: Review: Orgoglioso di questi ragazzi italiani a Londra. Locale molto bello da vedere e da vivere. Carne buonissima, offerta in diverse varianti. Abbiamo assaggiato un pò di piatti uno più buono dell'altro. Buona scelta dei vini. Staff super ok, gentile e alla mano. Conto un pò alto, ma siamo pur sempre a Londra.
197: Review: Siamo stati accolti con grand calore da giorgia e federica.ci hanno servito con attenzione e dedicazione, la carne è molto buona merita il prezzo che paghi, il servizio ben accurato e le camereriere sono ben informati dei prodotti che hanno. Per chi è amante della carne È nel posto giusto!
198: Review: I keep going there, I’m always welcomed as if I was family. Giorgia, my new favourite waiter, is always willing to find me a table when the place is full 😀
199: Review: This is an informal cafe style Italian restaurant with a busy local vibe. The staff were efficient and friendly offering helpful advice when required.The restaurant ages its own meat, which is served by weight. 400g per person was recommended to us (about right for 2 young men and an old fella) at £6.20/100g. Cheaper options are available but I have no complaints about value for money, especially when compared to other high end steak houses in town. The meat was absolutely delicious, beautifully cooked and beautifully presented, among the very best I have had and certainly better than anything I have eaten in London.Sides are reasonably priced and very tasty. Desserts are refreshingly inexpensive (£3 for a chocolate and orange truffle, £5 for a Torta di Mele), so you will be tempted even after consuming your enormous steak. Wine is all Italian and offered at a variety of prices from about £25 up to around a hundred. The Montepulcino at £32 went very well with the steak.Tuna steaks are also available. I will definitely return, I strongly suggest you give it a go, even if you have to go out of your way. Unless you are a vegan.
200:
Review: Service: 5/5

Food: 4/5
Lardo Bruschetta - Disappointing and very small
Heart - An acquired taste and not for us
T Bone Steak - AMAZING!
 
Drinks: 5/5

Value: 4/5

Ambience: 3/5
Lacking in atmosphere and empty for a Friday night
201: Review: Came here due to reviews. Fantastic meat, good service. No faults I could see.I would definitely come back.
202: Review: One of the best Italian restaurant in London. The prices seem to be a bit too high, but I think they're fair compared to the quality food. We've tried different of their locations and we found the same great service everywhere.
203: Title: Questa sì che è una bella mangiata!

Review: Tutto lo staff del ristorante,dal macellaio alla cameriera passando per la manager,sono stati professionali e attenti nel seguirci durante la nostra degustazione di prodotti italiani di eccellenza,come le carni fassona e frisona e del tonno, tutti preparati in modo semplice e genuino senza mascherarne l'autenticità. I prezzi sono perfettamente congrui considerando la qualità di ciò che si mangia. Da leccarsi i baffi dagli antipasti fino ai dolci!!
204: Review: In London, when it comes to dining out, you have choices. Many choices. Some will turn out to be great, others not so.It's actually quite seldom that a restaurants food let's it down, but this is the case here.The ambience is decent for a fast turning London establishment and the service friendly, if not a little chaotic.The food is however, terrible. Several choices not available on a Friday night notwithstanding (a steak restaurant without fillet or rump?!), the product when it arrived was worse than Camden street food post 2am.Far better choices out there (Hawksmoor, Vivat Bacchus - even CAU)
205: Title: great steak, way too expensive wine
Review: Great steak, cooked to perfection. Sadly the i felt like i was overcharged with the wine.. £42 for two 1/2 liter carafe, kind of a rip off..
206: Title: Excellent service from Michele @Macellaio and very very good food

Review: I can highly recommend Macellaio for the steak (beef or tuna) lover. The buffata (starter) is a must - bow torched gorgonzola on steak tartare. And the service was excellent. Michele looked after us and was very attentive. Full of good recommendations. 5 stars.
207: Title: Great meat at a reasonable price

Review: We really enjoyed our dinner at Macellaio in Clerkenwell. We had noticed the restaurant when we had dinner at Moro recently. The meat is absolutely incredible. It is tasty, soft and melts in your mouth. Service is very nice : the Italian waiters are fun and efficient. There are a lot of choices on the wine list, very reasonably priced. We paid £155 for three, having shared a one kilogram T-bone, starters, deserts and wine. Very good in London for such a quality of food
208: Title: Excellent même si un peu cher

Review: Nous avons découvert ce restaurant pas hasard car nous logions dans le quartier. J’y ai mangé la meilleure viande de ma vie. Un carpaccio suivie d’une pièce de bœuf avec roquette et parmesan. Plats très simple pour laisser toute la place à la saveur de la viande. Une fantastique découverte. Service très agréable et rapide. Endroit chaleureux et pas trop bruyant. Seul bémol le prix même si la qualité est au rendez-vous il vaut mieux être prévenu. Je recommande sans réserve !
209: Review: My boyfriend and I decided to try this restaurant suggested by a friend. We were greeted with warmth. Michele was our waiter who, with a lot of patience and knowledge of the menu, suggested us the best starter, the best steaks and a very good wine. We left satisfied and happy. We will definitely be back! Thanks Michele!
210: Title: Orgoglio italiano che rasenta la perfezione

Review: Questa è una di quelle recensioni che si è contenti di fare.Arriviamo in questo ristorante quasi per caso e del tutto impreparati: eravamo a Londra da 3 giorni e dopo 2 passati tra panini e fastfood volevo regalarci una cena seduti, al caldo; chiaro che la scelta di Londra è ampia ma è pur sempre vero incontrare i gusti di un italiano è impresa ardua.Dopo aver sfogliato mille e poi mille pagine web il mio compagno mi fa presente che un suo collega aveva nominato il “Macellaio”; a Londra ce ne sono 4 e optiamo per quello che con i mezzi poteva esserci più comodo, quello in zona Clerkenwell.Sabato sera, non abbiamo prenotato, siamo sotto le festività natalizie, sappiamo che stiamo tentando la sorte ma decidiamo di andare all'avventura.Arriviamo e veniamo accolti subito molto bene, ci spieghiamo in inglese finché non ho iniziato a tradurre al mio compagno ed è emerso che potevamo parlare in italiano: oltre il nome anche lo staff è completamente made in Italy.Triste notizia è che sono pieni ma mi suggeriscono di poter aspettare nella stanza accanto, al bar, prendermi qualcosa e rimanere al caldo … ci pensiamo un po’: di rimanere ad attendere in una stanza non mi andava, pochi giorni a Londra voglio sfruttare al massimo ogni momento, anche se il bar era una prospettiva attraente, così ci facciamo un giro arrivando a St. Paul; prima di uscire mi viene chiesto il numero di telefono e mezz’ora dopo vengo chiamato per dirmi che il mio tavolo è pronto. Fin da subito capiamo che il servizio sarebbe stato di alto livello.L’ambiente è particolare: unisce, se volete, i dettami classici della trattoria italiana ad un tocco di pub inglese, tutto fuso in modo estremamente elegante.Veniamo fatti accomodare da una ragazza simpatica ma anche gli altri membri dello staff, mentre passiamo, ci danno tutti la buonasera o anche un semplice “ciao!”.Ci portano i menu,, anche questi sono di un rustico raffinato, quasi un ossimoro che però cattura l'attenzione e pensi "però, fighi questi menu". Faccio opera di traduzione ma non essendo indigeno alcune parole ( esempio: noce moscata o la precisa zona del taglio del manzo) mi mancano; nessun problema, la signorina che ci segue traduce, spiega i tagli, suggerisce piatti tratti dalla tradizione italiana ma rielaborati da quelli che vi si attengano pedissequamente.Prendiamo due antipasti ( uno bresaola e stracchino, l’altro crudo e grana) , molto buoni e ben serviti, la qualità dei prodotti è italiana, ma da buon italiani ci manca qualcosa: il pane! Subito servito un cestino di pane che evidentemente era stato fatto fresco (unico appunto un po’ salato) così come la focaccia e, dopo averlo chiesto esplicitamente, arrivava la conferma: tutto fatto da loro in cucina.Piatti principali: uno la bistecca, io il petto di manzo coi funghi, che, aiutato da una legislazione locale che permette una frollatura maggiore (anche questo spiegatoci direttamente dallo staff) poteva essere servito con un risultato maggiore in termini di morbidezza e gusto.Due piatti, magnifici! Contorno purè di patata (buono) e patate arrosto (ottime).Ad alta perfomance i dolci: oltre i dolci normali ve ne erano due molto particolari e di ispirazione italiana; la crema fritta – tipica di molte regioni – ed una sorta di panna cotta della quale non si può svelare niente per non rovinare la sorpresa, elemento essenziale della portata.Oltre al cibo, che è stato di alto livello, ancora più di livello è stato il personale, che unisce la professionalità alla sensazione di essere veramente a cena da amici. Occupandomi spesso di valutazione del personale ho osservato come si muovevano nell’ambiente tutti gli appartenenti allo staff, come si rapportavano ai clienti, non lasciano trapelare alcuna scocciatura alle domande e richieste, spesso inappropriate e poco intelligenti, dei clienti, servono il cibo in modo simpatico e con un minimo di spettacolarità (dal far suonare i vassoi al fermarti con un coltello il conto), offrono molte spiegazioni, informazioni, oltre il cibo è una visita guidata nella cultura agroalimentare dell’Italia ma ripeto, tutto in simpatia.E' chiaro, inutile nasconderci, che il buon "cameriere" è colui che non solo porta il piatto ma riesce a venderti quello che è più buono, magari il più costoso o, alcune volte, quello che deve uscire dalla cucina; bene il personale potrebbe aver fatto tutto questo, guidandoci in una scelta delle portate opportunistica - il che significherebbe aver fatto bene il proprio lavoro - ma è stato fatto con un'educazione, una simpatia e, sopratutto, una naturalezza dei rapporti che, vi garantisco è andata ben oltre al conto, e l'ultimo piacevole saluto c'è stato quando addirittura eravamo già usciti dal locale.Gente, i membri del personale sono campioni naturali incrementati da un'ottima preparazione.Infine poter bere un caffè italiano fatto da italiani a Londra è stato come sentirsi “in salvo” dalla barbarie gastronomica inglese.Io sono rimasto colpito da Valeria, la ragazza che ci ha aiutato a scegliere – difficile definire tutto il personale “camerieri” perché sono qualcosa di più – e Walter che per un po’ si è seduto con noi così che potessimo continuare i discorsi iniziati poco prima.Il prezzo, è giusto dirlo, non è economico, ma perché economico non è il cibo, non è la cucina, non è il servizio, non lo sono le materie prime … paghi per quello che mangi, paghi il trovarti in un posto di valore, paghi, in modo del tutto proporzionato, l’esperienza che stai vivendo.Andare a Londra e lasciarsi sfuggire questo angolo di Italia è come trovarsi a Firenze e non fermarsi in Piazza della Signoria: entrambe sono cosa ricorderò delle rispettive città!Sono veramente entusiasta, e mi dispiacerebbe tornare "a casa loro" (perchè ospiti graditi ci siamo sentiti) e non trovare la stessa atmosfera e la stessa qualità ... per questo spero di tornarci presto.
211: Title: on average with rooms for improvement

Review: I went for dinner last Saturday with my boyfriend to celebrate and for the price paid I was expecting a bit of WoW factor.I am not sure if I will go back again beacuse the weakness of the whole experience was actually what suppose to be them strenght: the meat! Starters were good - burrata and beef carpaccio. Main of beef costata maybe was the wrong choice, I personally didn't like it much as I found the meat hard to eat.I was quite surprise even because i have been reccomended to this place and I had high expectiation Possibly was too croweded and, because of that, the Macellaio standard were a bit lower but I was expecting a memorable experience and I left the restaurant a bit disappointed.
212: Review: A regular of all macellaio’s restaurants in london. Exmouth market offers steak and fish menu (the only one of the four macellaios to offer fish).The steak tartar and the T-bone steak are choices that you can’t go wrong with. Friendly and welcoming service, ask for Valeria!
213: Title: Serata fantastica e ottima qualità/prezzo!

Review: Valeria ci ha servito in una maniera impeccabile. La professionalità, l’eleganza e la puntualità nel servire i prelibati piatti di carne della cucina de Il Macellaio mi hanno folgorato! Tornerò almeno una volta al mese! Brava Valeria!
214: Title: Best meat ever - fantastic service and clients care

Review: This restaurant it's quite famous also in Italy, tks to a famous TV program. I decided to go with a friend of mine, and it was an amazing choice. We ordered 3 kind of meat, including some "special tartare" (Raw meat), and some apetizer. Everything was incredible fantastic. They have a really important Italian vine selection. Stuff is really friendly and care a lot of clients. Price are in line with the quality of meal you get. I do suggest to try. Special thanks goes to Walter, that took great care of us. Cheers guys
215: Title: Not as good as last time

Review: Our experience was not as good as the last times we've been. Not helped by being sat at the back by the large glass window freezing cold. Starters were good - tuna with gorgonzola and beef carpaccio. Main of beef schnitzel was the wrong choice. The tuna was pretty average just with chopped baby tomatoes on top. The menu has changed since we last went a while ago, preferred it before.
216: Review: todo estuvo perfecto esa noche. La comida estuvo muy deliciosa, pero como olvidar a nuestro camarero Chris Super amable era nuestra primera vez en el restaurante y el nos explico todo muy bien detalle por detalle! una carne super buena y el vino mas, la tartar de carne estaba super! my familia y yo la pasamos muy comodos! Regresaremos pronto! y gracias pro el servicio!!
217: Review: Perfect service (Valeria the waiter was exceptional). Nice Italian restaurant with great food and great atmosphere
218: Review: Beautiful dinner as usual great service and atmosphere.. food well cooked and and well served.. big juicy steak and the battuta with Gorgonzola it’s just something you want every time on your table.. thanks guys we will be back!!!
219:
Review: Well done Michele and Valeria... great service and fabolous food...

Keep up the good job and don't let standard sleep ever!

Amazing fiorentina steak and great selection of wine.

Will be defenetly back.
220: Title: Great cuisine and welcoming staff

Review: I went yesterday with some friends and I enjoyed a lot the meat, perfectly cooked and great quality.The ambient is warm and spacious, you are not squized into a noisy restaurant but you have the space and the quietness to help you enjoy the night even more.We have been served with outstanding manners by the staff and our waiters Michele, Emanuela and the Spanish-speaker (I believe so) contributed a lot to make us enjoying the dinner with their kind manners and hints, seasoned with nice smiles as if we were their only clients.The price is ok for what it is, I got:- an amazing 6hg beef costata 37.50£- salad 4.90£- zuppa inglese 6£- a shared bottle of ruché (very good), water, service 12£For a total of 60£, a friend of mines got a rump steak for 15£ which made him spend much less.I'll definitely go again.
221:
Review: With some friends we were served by michele and Emanuela and the service was great. Beautiful place, delicious food and defenetely best service by these two guys.
We’ll be back soon
222: Review: Excellent dinner. Food was amazing and the service even better. Our waitress, Valeria, would go through the menu with us, explaining it in every little detail and suggesting us the best options. The whole dining experience was wonderful, definitely to repeat!
223: Review: I went today for a lunch and the food is really good, I been before in south Kensington but the service it was really different. Today looking after my Giorgia, I think she is a manager.. bye the way she was really friendly polite and clear to me. I was alone but I really enjoy my time whit her. Food all time is impeccable, (specially meet sides) thanks for today! We will see for another amazing meal
224: Title: Best Italian place in London

Review: Macellaio RC in Exmouth Market, is absolutely the best Italian restaurant in London, especially for those who love meat. Food is exceptional, the atmosphere is absolutely warm and sophisticated at the same time, without being posh though.The personnel is prepared and friendly, always ready to satisfy customers’ requests in a polite way. Particularly, I had the opportunity to meet Valeria more than once: she’s always been professional and friendly.Great variety of wine as well!I can’t wait to get back again!
225: Title: Ottima carne all'italiana, ma caro

Review: Ottimo ristorante prevalentemente di carne all'italiana. Costata saporitissima e cucinata alla perfezione. Servizio ottimo, ma costi troppo alti (150 sterline circa in 4 per una costata di 1.2 Kg, 1 antipasto in 4, senza vino).
226: Review: I went there on Sunday with my family and I had a great experience, thanks to Cristian (Cris) and his amazing food and wine suggestions. I am definitely going back.
227: Title: Great food and service - perfect for a birthday

Review: I booked for a group of friends for my birthday and they were very accommodating from the booking process to post meal. Food was incredible and they even brought out a piece of cake to sing happy birthday. I look forward to visiting again.
228: Title: Amazing birthday thanks to cristian!
Review: Going to keep this short and sweet. I had an amazinf birthday with my family and thanks to cristian for the recommendations from the wine to the food. The hanger steak is a must!
229:
Review: My 1 time in this restaurant with my boyfriend.
And not last time.
Beef carpaco for starter)))))
Main course grilled rabbit 
And of course amazing service  from Lukas  (kindly with good recommendations)     
Thanks Lukas for unforgettable
Evening..
230: Review: First of all, came here looking for a table of one and they welcomed me with open arms, gave me a choice of tables to sit on. Secondly, Christian (the waiter who looked after me) was on top of everything. He explained the menu very well and recommended I eat the tuna steak which was wonderful. He also came to check on me every now and then to make sure everything was ok. I'm partially deaf and it was slightly noisy in the restaurant so Christian came closer to me to speak in order that I heard everything which I really appreciated. I'm already planning my next visit here with some friends!!
231: Title: A corner of Italy in London!

Review:  I've been in Macellaio with my father and we had a really nice experience! We are from Florence..so really picky about food especially meat but the "costata" was very good and cooked in a proper way! The cheeses were lovely (thanks to the chef who choose them!). The staff was really professional and a special thanks goes to Michele, our waiter. He took care of us answering all our questions!
232: Review: I’m an Italian girl and I study at city university of London and with my timetable sometimes I need to find somewhere close to eat fast with my friends. Macellaio is the perfect place for that because it’s near uni you can get the best quality at a reasonable price with a perfect service!I also recommend it for dinner because the food is always good and the atmosphere is great.I have to admit that Macellaio is the place where I ate the best Italian food so far!A greeting to Giorgia and Valeria who always treat us with kindness!
233: Review: franchement j ai jamais manger de viande plus bien que ici.Ambiance au top, toute l equipe est Italienne , la serveuse Valeria trés gentil et elle m'a conseillé un vin apulien le Neprica, parfait pour le plat que j'ai choisi le costata medium, excellente cuisson.je conseille aussi le cannelloni al fiasco et battuta avec de gorgonzola.
234:
Review: Nice place, great hospitality, great quality of meat and good selection of wines. 
I will definitely stay here again!
235: Review: Siamo stati a cena ieri sera. Nonostante avessimo prenotato per le 21, pur presentandoci lì un'ora dopo, non ci sono stati problemi. La carne è stata favolosa, consiglio assolutamente di passarci. Menzione speciale a Michele: un ragazzo amichevole e servizievole che non ci ha fatto assolutamente mancare nulla, ma anzi, ci ha fatti sentire coccolati, ci ha fatti sentire a casa in Italia nonostante i km che ci separino. Grazie, grazie, grazie!
236: Review: Came here as we were going to a trade event and wanted lunch first. The food is amazing, the Parma ham beautiful and the beef tartar was also beautiful and flavoursome. The steak we ordered was the rib 800oz to share and that was melt in your mouth. We had a bottle of prosecco with our meal which was also delightful.The staff were very friendly and the guy cutting the meats for you on demand- you could see how happy he was when we said how enjoyable the meal was.Will definitely be back. Grazie
237: Review: Met my girlfriend after a long and busy day, hungry, thirsty and need of a good time. My company was great and the front of the place is inviting. A butchers window attached to a nice looking bar. We were directed to a garden to the rear withe some very cheap wonky furniture.The food was laughable- so small you would need magnification to see it. Really felt cheated and to top it off it took an age to get the bill. I thought about legging it having asked 3 times and waited almost half hour for the excessive bill. They asked if everything was ok and i told them the truth. They were very ungracious and dismissive about it, treating us like we didnt belong there. Bunch of snobs ripping people off. Will not return
238: Review: I went with a friend for dinner and we had a truly amazing experience! Great food, 10/10 steak and super friendly and quick service (we were even given a phone charger) - would definitely recommend!!
239: Review: Abbiamo prenotato un tavolo per le 21.30. Era la prima volta per me che andavo al Macellaio mentre i miei amici lo conoscevano già. Siamo stati accolti da un amichevole staff e la cameriera( valeria) ci ha serviti e consigliati con tanta gentilezza. La carne era eccellente, si scioglieva in bocca come fosse burro. Posto molto confortevole e tranquillo. Di sicuro ci tornerò molto presto!
240: Review: Ristorante perfetto! Abbiamo avvisato che saremmo arrivate in ritardo, intorno alle 11 quando chiudevano la cucina e ci hanno accolto a braccia aperte! Il cibo più buono che in Italia a e il personale impeccabile :) un piacere vedere così tanti ragazzi giovani che lavorano in questo bellissimo ristorante! Ci tornerei ogni sera giuro e un big shoutout a VALERIA che è fantastica!!! Spero di tornare presto, grazie per portare l'Italia all estero !!!
241: Review: Me and family visited Macellaio for the first time and we were amazed by the hostility we were shown especially from Cristian, he was very well educated in the wines and he knew a lot about the background of the restaurant (foods) he told us in depth about the meat and how it is aged ' he even took me on a tour. He was very polite to me and my family and recommended some really nice dishes. We will definitely be going back. Food,atmosphere,hospitality absolutely fantastic. Thank you very much Cristian and to the rest of the staff.
242: Title: Very good service, food not the best!

Review: I’ve finally tried this renowned restaurant.The staff welcomed us in a very good way, they are very professional and warm. The service provided was excellent. Food in my opinion doesn’t worth the price. We started with beef tongue e lardo bruschetta, then pigeon and beef shoulder steak served with roast and mash potatoes. Tongue didn’t taste a lot, pigeon wasn’t perfectly cooked but the idea to serve it with stew apple is great, potatoes were over cooked, too small and dry
243: Title: Probably the best beef I've had
Review: I was introduced to this place by a bunch of Italian friends and its actually kind of made me change my mind about becoming a vegetarian. So yea, it's pretty amazing.
244: Review: They serve the most fabulous Fassona dry aged steaks I ever had. And I am Italian. Really love this place everytime they deliver. Our host Valeria was super nice and she deserves a mention!
245:
Review: High quality meat from Italy cooked right. 
We took two huge ribeyes and a selections of starters. 
Thanks Valeria for the great service!
246: Review: Without doubt one of the best steaks in London. Have been to the South Kensington one a few times, equally great, first time to the Exmouth Market branch, it did not disappoint. Staff were friendly and helpful. T-bone steak is amazing.
247: Review: Servizio ottimo, cibo eccellente come sempre!! Ci ha serviti Valeria, una ragazza molto disponibile e gentile. Lo consigliamo!!
248: Review: We met friends here for dinner on a week night. Three of us shared a 700 gram rib eye steak, brocolini, green beans and a bottle of red wine (a Sangiovese). My husband had pasta and a tuna tartare appetizer. My friend and I shared a burrata and tomato salad. We finished it off with a Tiramisu and some dessert wine. It was all amazing!! I would definitely recommend a visit to this restaurant!
249: Review: Is always nice to dine here, the food is amazing and the staff attentive, in particular Giorgia that last time looked after us making our visit impeccable. Can't wait to go back!
250: Review: Accueil chaleureux, service parfait( merci à gorgia et valeria) , il y avait 5/10 minutes d'attente et on nous a fait patienter avec un apéritif (Payant) dans leur bar à côté.Certes je peux comprendre, sans être d'accord, avec les mauvais avis laissés a leur sujet car quand on ne sais pas ce que c'est une viande maturée (dry age), alors payer 30/40€ pour sa viande peux paraitre cher, mais ce sont des viandes extraordinaires maturées 50 jours ( dommage que que sur la mienne ils aient laissé trop de gras et que ce dernier avait un peu le goût de rance), mais cela reste extra.Je peux comprendre aussi que certains trouvent qu'il n'y ai pas assez de pâtes dans les plats, mais pour 10£ (pour les plus chères) ça reste très très correct, n'oublions pas que nous sommes à Londres...Les pâtes étaient cuites al dente comme en Italie dont je suis originaire et mes filles ont bcp appréciées.Le vin et les bières italiennes (oui oui il font aussi des bières ) étaient très bien. Bref presque parfait...Merci
251: Review: I went with a group of friends to enjoy an aperitif and some Italian vibes We been literally surprised about the tapas and the great service provided by the amazing Valeria Steak tartare, bruschetta , ceviche , stracciatella. All very good Nice selection of wines , and spirits Deserve a visit
252: Review: Went with a bunch of friends on the weeknight and had mixed reviews.The starters were nice, some tuna carpaccio, ceviche and burrata. Nice touch was a little complement of some salami like meat. For the mains, some of us opted for two plates from the starters, others went for the actual main menu. Mine steak tartar was nice but a pit under seasoned, tuna bresaola was excellent though, couldn't help myself to share it with the whole table. The rump with rocket and parmigiano steaks that two of the party ordered looked nice but very chewy and fatty as people said. The rabbit was nicely cooked and flavoured and the baby chicken was good as well, poor meat to bone ratio was the only downside.All and all was a pleasant evening, apart from the fact we weren't getting much attention. Had to flag the staff after 20 minutes of sitting down to take our order, which was quite frustrating since the place wasn't even that busy. Took as much to get the bill as well.
253: Review: Had now my third experience at IL MACELLAIO. As I work in Exmouth Market since  mid-april, it bacame one of my favourite place. Meat is absolutely great, service is very pleasant. Couldn't ask for more. I'll definitely go back soon!!!!
254: Title: Great food and great service

Review: As a first timer at Macellaio RC, it was a delight to be served by Georgia, guiding us effortless through the menu. We even took her up on some of her recommendation and were not disappointed - the battuta was It’s rare that I give a recommendation for a restaurant but I think good service is all too often forgotten, and should be celebrated. Thank you for a superb meal, we’ll 100% be back.
255: Review: Our first visit to this Restaurant for dinner before seeing a show at Sadler's Wells Theatre, which is ten minutes walk away.We had a very warm greeting from the staff and were shown through to a small bar area while we looked through the menu, which is presented in a newspaper format.As we only had an hour and a half before the show, we were keen to get started and again the staff were most accommodating. Taking us through to the restaurant area and seating us at a spacious table.A quick but very comprehensive resume of the menus and we were soon eating our way through some delicious starters and looking forward to our main courses which were going to be shared rib eye steak (with bone) and tuna.When the main dishes arrived we were most impressed, the beef was cooked just as we had asked, rare and was very tender and full of flavour.The tuna, again served rare as we asked was also excellent.The meal was accompanied by a good bottle of wine.Our bill was presented when we asked and our only issue was of our own making in that we had to rush off to the theatre.Will definitely go back when we are not going to the theatre!
256: Review: There's small bar next to the restaurant (which still belongs to Il Macellaio) that serves happy hour at £4.50 everyday between 4pm-7pm... but no sign shows the list of drinks and cocktails available at the special price. So I ended up in 2 Campari spritz for £ 16. This is not fair at all! The bar has just lost 2 potential Italian customers
257: Title: Fantastic Meat! Superb feel, sharing platters

Review: Starters were superb, order enough for 1 per person and share. The steaks are also ordered by weight and shared. We took the rib eye and T-bone, both were superb but the Rib eye was exceptional. Recommend to order enough for 300g per person and just less than 1 side per person. Fantastic wines Skip the deserts, they were not good.
258: Review: Oh how much I loved Macellaio!Simple concept, high quality produce, great wine list, friendly staff.Needless to say every meat dish I tried (carpaccio, battuta, ribeye) was phenomenal, cooked to perfection and amazingly seasoned.Bravi!
259: Review: First of all let me say : thank you Giorgia you have been very helpfull and made our lunch memorable, we started with gorgonzola carpaccio and stracciatella ( mozzarella ) delicious and than we eat what we came for......a very big and tender steak 800g.Very good food , the list of wine is impressive if you need suggestion don t be shy, ask.Price wise what can I say : good wine and amazing meat are not cheap but totally deserve it.
260: Review: Casualmente durante un viaggio a Londra ci siamo imbattuti ne 'Il Macellaio' che conoscevamo per la trasmissione televisiva 4 ristoranti di Alessandro Borghese. Che dire? Mangiato benissimo, personale gentilissimo e location molto accattivante. Unico neo il conto (un po' salato), Dolce al basilico che non mi ha convinto mentre buonissimi i dolcetti fritti.
261: Title: T-bone steak to die for

Review: The best steak I have EVER had (and I've eaten a many over the years - fillet steak and chateaubriand, mainly). Don't hesitate - just order the T-bone steak to share with someone and I promise you won't be disappointed. The tuna was also fantastic. Decent wine, friendly service... frankly, I won't bother going to any other restaurant in London for steak, in future. Bravo, Macellaio! Thank you so much.
262: Review: A nice venue, interesting and a good atmosphere. They specialise in Beef and Tuna and both were of good quality. We were a largish group and the venue recommended sharing platters of starters which were very good but lacked a little in variety. Mains were smallish and the cost is a bit high. My summary would be that it was OK and did the job on the night but none of our group would rush back. It may well be a much better experience for smaller parties.
263: Review: The real experience is to buy a large piece of steak for the group of you (we shared 800 g for 3). It comes in this massive piece and makes the dinner into a great experience! And it certainly was the most aged-tasting steak I've ever had, but in a good way. Would strongly suggest to all steak lovers. The sides, I have to admit, are very overpriced and not great for what they are. From starters, I enjoyed the carpaccio and burrata. Wine is very expensive, but we opted for the cheapest red in the menu (there is only one option under 30 pounds, and that's something like 29 anyway:) ) but it was very nice still!
264: Title: Meat lovers, this is the place to go

Review: From the moment we went in until it was time to leave it was clear that this restaurant means business! All the starters are top quality products, the crudo in particular. In terms of mains, both the meat and the fish are some of the best of their kind and do not miss out on the basil desert at the end, it's very unique. The wine list is extensive and is definitely worth asking for advice - we were recommended a delicious wine that we thoroughly enjoyed.
265: Review: Having met up with my wife after work, we went window shopping for somewhere to eat in Exmouth Market. Have to say we nearly missed Macellaio, having walked past it once thinking it was a closed butchers shop. On second passing we cautiously entered and asked for a table. The restaurant was very busy, but the manager managed to squeeze us in. I loved the newspaper style menu. Seeing that beef was a speciality, I chose steak tartare to start,followed by a tagliata rump steak cooked rare. My wife had buratta followed by a medium tagliata. My steak tartare was perfect and the tagliata beautifully cooked exactly as ordered. My wife commented that her beef was probably the best she'd had for some years - and she loves her steak! We eat out a lot and cook well at home and Macellaio was one of the most enjoyable experiences we've had for a long time. I mustn't forget the staff who were very friendly and attentive, particularly our waiter who took some time explaining the menu and the cuts of meat. All in all a great evening - thank you Macellaio. We'll be back.
266: Review: Went for dinner on thursday with 2 friends. Good wine, nice people. Average ossobuco, terrible cox tail. The tuna with amazingly undercooked potatoes was a ridiculous scarce main dish. We will never ever come back.
267: Review: Entradas típicas italianas y un segundo fantástico de 1,200kg. de carne muy buena. Se puede ver y si quieres elegir la pieza de carne que quieres tomar
268: Review: Andavo in questo locale a Genova da bambina. La location è carina e il cibo piuttosto buono anche se le porzioni sono un po' scarse, ma in linea con questo tipo di ristoranti a Londra. Vino CONSIGLIATO per un prezzo di 25£ AL BICCHIERE. Non si consiglia un vino a questo prezzo senza prima avvisare, soprattutto se genovese servendo genovesi. Abbiamo pagato senza battere ciglio (in 2 120£ solo di vino) ma non tornerò di certo.
269: Review: Proper Italian meat restaurant with great cuts of the best meat. Had the T Bone to share amongst three, delicious. Puddings good as well. Best is that you can take your own wine for a small corkage.
270: Review: Bel locale con piatti succulenti prevalentemente basati su carne fassona e tonno siciliano da leccarsi i baffi!
271: Review: La tagliata con la rucola e parmigiano è buonissima cosi come la selezione di vini di qualità ci ritornerò assolutamente
272: Review: Devo dire che non mi aspettavo di mangiare una carne così buona e tenera Personale gentile e cordiale Voto 10 e lodeVi consiglio di farci un salto se siete a Londra
273: Review: Luckily this place has charm and atmosphere in abundance. It makes up for the food which in other circumstances might be considered ordinary. Generally we eat in places which make us feel good and Macellaio certainly does this. A butcher's shop at the front and a very cool restaurant at the back. Predominantly red and white with great graphic touches , the decoration is very well considered and puts one in the mood from the off. In addition the young staff are charming and friendly without being unprofessional. The wine list is full of decent vintages and i ordered a good bottle of Amarone which at £94 was one of the priciest but by the end of the last glass seemed eminently worth it. The menu generally comprises small dishes . Everything we ate was tasty but variably seasoned. Either far too much or too little. We also shared a rib eye of their dry aged Italian beef. Although i was really in the mood it didnt measure up to Waitrose organic Scottish meat by a long chalk and i am beginning to wonder on the merits of dry aging anyway. I mean who cares. It would have been tender anyway and i just dont know if the real flavour hadnt evaporated during that month on a hook. Regardless this is a very good , enjoyable evening out and i came away feeling i would like to return soon. I think it would also make a great place for a small party. Coffee is also excellent!!!! On a par with Frescobaldi.
274: Review: O que dizer quando tudo é bom.Um espaço muito tipico, limpo e acolhedor.Um restaurante com um staff maravilhoso, tenho a destacar a empregada "Sandy", foi muito amável, simpática e uma amiga. Percebeu que o nosso inglês não era muito fluido e prontificou-se logo a ajudar, apesar de ser italiana falava fluentemente o espanhol.A carne é ao peso, mas vale bem a pena o que se paga.O vinho aconselhado pela Sandy estava muito bom.Sobremesas deliciosas para crianças e adultos.Foi servido aos adultos um licor delicioso como oferta.
275: Review: I have been to this restaurant a couple of times and before you even start on the food, i just want to say the staff are so friendly and lovely, the food is beyond good, be it fish or meat you can not go wrong ! GO GO GO !!!
276: Review: It could look a bit rough from the outside, but when inside it starts to get better, and then the time you seat and you start to be served... an attentive waiter expose the menu in details, giving his opinion and suggesting the best deal for you. The service is followed by, I would say a sommelier, that with charm and knowledge expose the wine, involving you and your friends with simply questions (and answers) about your wine choice background. Following a funny waitress which interact always with a big smile. "La cena è servita" starters, main and dessert: delicate, simple and even if portions are small I would definitely recommend this place.
277: Review: Ero in vacanza a Londra con amici e gli ho proposto di portarli a cena in un posto che avevo conosciuto tramite un programma televisivo, dove ho visto una grande passione da parte del proprietario nel descrivere il suo locale ma soprattutto i piatti tipici che fanno , la voglia di provare questo posto era tanta ma soprattutto una volta assaggiati i piatti non mi hanno deluso anzi , mi hanno lasciato un acquolina in bocca da voler tornarci ! Antipasto mix di crudi di carne e come secondo due fiorentine da 1,2kg e 1,00kg contorno spinaci e patate al forno (top).Dolce WOW bianco al basilico con croccante al caramello! Personale FANTASTICO!
278: Review: I absolutely recommend everyone to come to this place at least once! Quality of Italian food excellent, superb wines, friendly environment and super kind staff! A special thanks to Sandy who gave us the best food suggestions ever! Will definitely come back here!
279: Title: Nice but at a price
Review: Enjoyable evening but quite expensive. My fiorentina was good but friends fillet was not. Waiters were polite and friendly . Ok but not one of my favourites
280: Review: Super lunch for two businessmen Delicious ribeye cooked to medium rare perfectionKnowledgeable staff who were prompt and courteous I am going back !!!
281:
Review: Best Italian meat
Great service from Anitta
Highly recommended for meat lovers
Style is nice as well, great seating plan, and the pig fat starter is the best
282: Title: Good if you aren't Italian

Review: We were lured by the amazing appearance of the meat cellar which you can see while walking along the street of Exmouth Market. My friend and I are both meat lovers so we didn't think twice. We entered and a young lad showed us a nice bit of "costata", which in English should translate to ribeye steak. The marbling looked amazing so we decided to go for that one, rather than the posher "fiorentina".To start we ordered some steak tartare and tuna carpaccio. The waiter asked us if we wanted the tartare with anchovies and other condiments, we said yes, but the tartare came as a plain one. No bread provided with it, which should be, and we had to ask for it. The tuna carpaccio consisted of 3 slices of uber-seasoned fish (lots of pepper, salt and some fine herbs), otherwise tasteless, and not great in aspect either. The steak came and it was served on a black dish (I believe it was cast iron). The temperature of the dish was mild at best, and in fact the steak went cold really quickly. There was a latent, subtle after taste of fridge to it, and it wasn't as tender as we expected.The side dishes of chips and roasted potatoes were nothing special and in hindsight (after seeing the bill) the price was extortionate too, given the size of their portions.Overall, we were not happy with the service either: we had to wait ages between courses, more than anything acceptable within the whole idea of slow-food; no one came to ask us whether we wanted more drinks (which should be the number 1 thing any good-selling waiter should do..we could have probably spent 3 times as much on beer); and we had to wait ages even to get the 2 coffees that were kindly offered by the house, which we ended up drinking on our way out as we couldn't wait any longer.On our way out we also took a quick look at the meat counter and saw that the bit of beef the lad showed us, to explain what cut we were going to get, was still there. If the beef cut looked untouched, then, I guess, the conclusion is that the steak we were served came from somewhere else, which I find a bit "debatable", shall we say.I am really disappointed by the experience. I thought I could taste the flavours of my home again, for one night, without having to catch a flight. I hoped I'd found a must-come-back place, but the truth is that I will not be giving them my money ever again.
283: Review: Mangiato un trittico di carne cruda da urlo ! Bravi i ragazzi !!! Un clima tutto italiano .... bravi !
284: Review: Le vetrine frigo attraggono lo sguardo di chi passeggia,non e' da tutti i giorni vedere esposto un tonno intero o un quarto di mucca! Normalmente non ami i ristoranti italiani all'estero MA visto che la cucina londinese non e' famosa nel mondo decido di entrare! Locale accogliente,curato nei dettagli con un ambiante "famigliare"Camerieri gentili e disponibili! I prezzi in linea con Londra,e' una citta' cara! Menu ricco di proposte,ottima l'idea della cucina povera ( quella della nonna per capirsi) ma decido di provare la tartarre di tonno (OTTIMA),E UNA BELLA BISTECCA CON L'OSSO! Carne di ottimo sapore,perfettamente cucinata e presentata! Da ricornare! Buona la scelta dei vini ...e quelli si che sono un po' carucci ma il vizio di bere vino italiano in Inghilterra si paga!
285: Review: I went in to this restaurant with a colleague having been turned away by an Italian restaurant just up the road. What a stroke of luck!This place specialises in Italian tuna and Italian steaks. The menus works on small plates to start, all traditional Italian foods, then a selection of steaks or tuna dishes. There is a small selection of what they call "Poor Dishes" at the back of the menu which are traditional Italian peasant dishes if you don't fancy steak.However, we fancied steak. So, we chose three small plates to share as a starter and then ordered a ribeye steak to share for our main course.The starters were great but the steak was truly spectacular! I've eaten steak all over the world and this has to be up there with the best of them. It was tender, beautifully cooked and had an absolutely amazing flavour.Add to this, great service and a really good red wine and you've got the perfect night out.Can't recommend this place highly enough.
286: Review: Very excellent food (the fiorentina and tartare amazing)and fantastic service (compliment to Anita for the suggestion and kindness)
287: Review: I've been there 3 times already! and i can not stop it!!!!! if you want to eat amazing tuna or amazing meat this is the best place to go! i recommend it 100%!!!!
288: Title: Best steak ever in london

Review: It was my first time in this restaurant and I was so impressed how the staff was really efficient and acknowledge also so kind to us . The tartare with Gorgonzola so delicious. We will come back for sure. A big thanks to all the team that makes feel us at home.
289: Title: Mostly excellent, but some faults - 3.5/5

Review: I visited twice before reviewing, once as a couple, and one as a group of four.FoodFirst off, the more people you have the better, as this is very much a sharing restaurant. The food is generally excellent. We tried several off the starters. Particular favourites were the tuna carpaccio and the beef bresaola. We loved being able to eat the tuna and beef together and we're stunned at how similar they tasted. The battuta was also very well prepared, and melts in your mouth. We also had a mixed seared beef/tuna plate. I didn't love the sauces that came with this, but it got demolished by the table. One complaint would be that the starters (and sides) are very small - probably no more than 4/5 mouthfuls each. For a sharing concept restaurant it would be great if they could devise a taster plate which gives you a mouthful of more than starter. This would be much easier than divvying up starters between four people. For our main we had the t bone steak - perfectly cooked medium rare, and accompanied by very good wine (about £30 for a bottle). On our first visit we had chips (not great), and changed to roast potatoes (great!) on the second visit. The green vegetables are all well cooked and seasoned - no complaints here. Finally, for dessert we had the chocolate cake and the cheese cake. The cheese cake was not a winner across the table (too sweet, and the base too soft), but the chocolate cake got a universal thumbs up... so much so that we ordered another to share!Overall, I'd go back, but it would be good to see the starters in a form that is a bit more easily shared. ServiceWe were left with a bad impression, as we needed to send back our second order of chocolate cake back twice to be heated through, and it felt like a fuss. However, service was otherwise very good - the waiter was helpful in explaining the concept, suggesting a range of meat/fish and matching the wine to what we had ordered. PriceOn our first visit we paid £77 for two, and on the next visit £196 for four. On each occasion we had three courses and wine. I'd say that the side orders are a bit on the stingy side - probably 1 1/2 portions per item, and you'd hope to be able to share between at least two people. Overall we thought the price was fair - but towards the upper end of what we'd be happy to spend on this meal. 12.5% service is added to your bill - something I prefer to choose myself. Budget £40-50 per person including wine.OverallFood - 4/5Service - 3.5/5Price - 3/5Total - 3.5/5
290: Review: Dined at Macellaio for myp birthday.Just to say that the service was absolutely outstanding, very attentive.The food was fantastic but the portions were a bit small.The rump steak was divine but salt and pepper at the table would have been good as I would have liked to add a bit more seasoning to mine.As it was my birthday, brownies and liquers were offered by the house, which I think was a lovely touch.We will definitely be back to try some more dishes.I highly recommend a visit:)
291: Review: Che la cucina Italiana sia la migliore lo sappiamo tutti, ma mangiare delle pietanze con una qualità così elevata, è quasi impossibile. Il tutto condito, con un ambiente, ed un servizio impeccabile. A completare il quadro così già perfetto, ci pensa l'accurato e sapiente intervento del metre Walter. Una fonte copiosa di ricette ed ingredienti, che fa spazio e alletta quello che dopo si può davvero capire solo mangiando.Insomma davvero un'esperienza da Provare nella vita.OTTIMO!
292: Title: Different and good but you really need to like beef

Review: We didn't research Macellaio at all which was our fault as one of our party doesn't eat beef. Which is a bit of a problem as that is about 60% of the menu.Most of the other 40% is Tuna, which makes the menu rather lopsided but what we had was really good - a tuna steak tartare being the highlight for me.Good friendly service and not that expensive overall, and we left happy but the steaks really did look good.
293: Title: Italian style with a difference.

Review: This is not your regular Italian restaurant. You can forget your regular pizza and pasta dishes, this place is a cut above the rest (the pun is very much intended). i was initially drawn by the shop front as I wanted to have a look at what appeared to be a very traditional, old fashioned butchers shop. I was not disappointed as this is exactly what it is with the addition of the fishmonger next door. With the look and feel of early twentieth century, the service complimented the style too. Friendly, efficient and knowledgable staff helped us with our choice of wine and matching it to our food choice. The butcher preps your meet at the front of the shop before it is presented and cooked to your taste. Before the food arrives our steak knives are stabbed into the work oak tables at which you sit. The meat is special, cooked properly, served properly and melts in the mouth. we cannot wait to go back and spend more time here.
294: Review: We enjoyed a grea evening in the Macellaio. The meat was very nice and the olace is cosy. Even the broccoly tasted fantastic ;) thanks!
295: Review: Food was ok, meat a bit over cooked.Alex the waiter was very kind and professional , the service was nice!
296: Review: It is not only great food, it is the entire dinning experience which makes this restaurant special. We visited once and definitely planning to come back again. We were recomended small meat and fish dishes to share acompained with fresh salad and grilled vegetables and I must say I had a pleasure to taste the best beef tartar and tuna steak in my life. Do not leave without trying the cheesecake, it is absolutely amazing. The staff is very friendly and passionate about food, happy to help or recomend menu. Best place for meat and wine lovers.
297: Review: I m an italian cook and while i was walking near by the restaurant ,i ve decided to walk in to the Macellaio with a friend with me. I loved the atmosphere straight away because sourrunded by a really attentive staff. After a really difficult decision about what to have for dinner because most of the food really attractive we both decided to go for the famous classic dish of the North Italian kitchen: ossobuco and vitello tonnato. What to say:simply amazing!the cooking of the ossobuco just perfect and the same for the riso crunchy and soft inside.vitello tonnato with a really tasty sauce. We are going to visit you really soon because we really enjoyed our experience at your restaurant. Keep going
298: Title: Miglior Ristorante Italiano a Londra
Review: La miglior costata mai assaggiata, per non parlare del carpaccio e dello spezzatino di tonno... eccezionali. Servizio impeccabile e ambiente ospitale.
299: Title: Awful steak and tuna. And overpriced!!!

Review: What is wrong with this place? It specialises in steak and tuna. You'd expect both to be knockout especially as the prices they're charging are high. The starters we had were very good in all fairness despite one of them not arriving until just before the first course arrived. However, the mains were a cynical manoeuvre in "talk up the goods and they will believe they are good". T-bone steak was chewy and full of fat. Tuna main course was stinky, chewy and generally old to ancient. We should have known the cynical nature of the business when the side salad arrived without any dressing (no olive oil etc on the table) and looking at least a day old. In summary, save your money and go somewhere else.
300: Review: Ottima carne ottimo servizio grazie Alessandro ritorneremo avanti così se devo trovare una pecca tavolini un Po piccoli ma a Londra ci può stare
301: Review: Went here for the first time late December. Friendly staff, attentive and welcoming. Food excellent. Best steak I have had in years and in great quantity. Starters of steak tartar, thin bread filled with cheese and cheese and leak tart between 5 people followed by amazing t-bone and rib eye with potatoes and broccoli. Nice wine selection and friendly atmosphere. Definitely returning soon.
302: Title: Nice food, very high price

Review: I went with a friend. We had one starter between 2 (it was a very nice Stracciatella with Bottarga but TINY portion.. basically 3 mouthfulls of food), 1 steak between 2 (800g of T bone) and 1 side (3 mouthfulls of roasted veg) plus 1 bottle of wine (about £41). Total bill... £120. Cannot say the food wasn't nice, but i left totally starving. To be full, I think we would have to have doubled each food order.. i.e. pay £100 each. A nice steak, no doubt... but not £100 nice.
303: Title: A really good italian in the historical italian hood

Review: I have been there just once intrigued by the good reviews that I had from my italian friends. The thing that surprised me the most is the high quality and the freshness of all the ingredients. You can find really good italian dishes that you usually you get cooked from your mother or your grandma back home and as well some delicatessen and above all really good meat. I would definitely recommend it and moreover it is so much better (quality and price wise) than most of the high end italian restaurants I tried in London.
304: Review: Se vieni a Londra metti in preventivo che il mangiare lascia a desiderare, fino al momento in cui per caso entri dentro in ristorante macelleria. Qui e' tutto meglio della cucina della nonna, ma dico sul serio, antipasti tipo piemontese con cicchetti la pasta al pesto piu buona di sempre e che dire della carne ? mai mangiata cosi buona neanche in Italia !tiramisu per finire, daro' la ricotta a mia nonna :)
305: Review: Everything was perfect at this cosy Italian restaurant in the earth of London, my and my 3 friend won't easy forget it .. we had a match of Tuna and Fassone Beef from north Italy dry aged up to 9 weeks .. wow !Buffalo mozzarelle to start with and raw tuna, ( sashimi style )following by Tuna cacciatora and rib-eye steak with the best roasted potatoes I ever had. great selection of wines and perfect and attentive service toowe will come back at next London visit
306: Title: Successo anche per mia figlia
Review: Sono tornato in questo ristorante di passaggio con mia figlia di 10 anni... per me è stata una conferma per lei un successo !! Torneremo
307: Review: Dissapoint meal, cold meat , cold tuna I can't believe a place specialist in beef they served COLD MEAT GRILLED , the restaurant should be specialist on tuna as well , tuna bresaola wasn't not home made and the only cut they served was the tuna loin in a crust of breadcrums , cold with a very soft crust around ( I would have expected a crispy crust). The Bread was hard , not tasty at all. The restaurant looked very dirty , the toilet , the front door and all the meat expose looked very messy and not attractive at all. Is not enough have a great quality of meat if you don't know how to serve it!! I went to the another restaurant in union street and the experience was great, great food, great manager ,the restaurant was super clean and beautiful atmosphere , great everything!!! I'm very disappointed because I went there with a important person in London restaurant environme
308: Title: SPECIALITA' GENUINE DI CARNE E TONNO: DA NON PERDERE!

Review: In quattro giorni di soggiorno a Londra, ho avuto il piacere di pranzare e cenare nei tre Ristoranti "Il Macellaio RC" di Roberto Costa. In tutti tre i locali io e la mia famiglia siamo rimasti letteralmente impressionati dalla bontà e dalla genuinità dei cibi serviti da personale competente, disponibile, affabile e sempre pronto ad accertarsi che tutto fosse di nostro gradimento, mettendoci al corrente, ad ogni portata, della provenienza e della preparazione di ciò che ci accingevamo a mangiare e bere. Il locale in 38-40, Exmouth Market è accogliente e dall’atmosfera rilassante. Ci siamo sentiti molto a nostro agio. Tipici e dal sapore unico e caratteristico gli antipasti: carpaccio di tonno (eccezionale); le battute di carne cruda al Gorgonzola e all’Albese (ottime); la Fassona tonnata (veramente speciale). Una curiosità ci ha spinto ad ordinare poi un’Amatriciana al guanciale e tonno: veramente buona e particolare. Abbiamo continuato con una eccellente bistecca di tonno con patate, arrosto e spinaci (insuperabili) ed un’Orecchia di elefante panata, altra ottima specialità. Gustare sapori nuovi e contemporaneamente genuini è il top! Il tutto accompagnato da una vasta scelta di vini sapientemente suggeriti dal personale ed adatti ai cibi consumati. Per finire mix di dolci: latte dolce fritto e il delicatissimo ed unico “bianco al basilico”. Complimenti vivissimi al titolare Roberto Costa che abbiamo avuto il piacere di conoscere e di renderci conto che è veramente una persona semplice ed unica sia nel rapporto con la clientela che col personale: secondo me è il datore di lavoro che tutti vorrebbero! Abbiamo visto anche la trasmissione di Alessandro Borghese “4 Ristoranti” e siamo pienamente d’accordo che “Il Macellaio RC” di Roberto Costa sia risultato il miglior ristorante Italiano a Londra: la sua competenza in materia e il suo gesto finale non fanno che avvalorare la mia stima nei suoi riguardi. Complimenti!
309: Review: Sur le conseil avisé du Restaurant The Narrow qui était complet ce soir là nous sommes allés à l'inconnu pour un italien. Accueil sympa puis nous nous sommes laissés conseiller par la serveuse puis la le festival du goût a commencé. Que du bonheur et tous les avis étaient unanimes pour une fois . On nous a gentiment proposé et servi différentes entrées puis en plat du bœuf du Piémont et du thon au romarin ensuite les desserts : un summum de délicatesse. Choix de vins qui en en accord avec la carte.Aucune hésitation
310: Review: been there with my partner on friends recommendation .. we walked by exmouth market friday night and get into this italian corner with no reservation, and we have been accommodate in 5 min and in the middle time they offered us some yummy bresaola. Staff was so professional and a girl explain to us how the menu works and we went for her suggestion, match of beef and tuna we had both tartare, tune was outstanding and perfectly dressed up tune steak and rib eye to follow with chips and spinach, that was for sure the best steak i ever had in my whole life, last twist was the cheese cake at the end, out of this world do not gorget your chianti, goes amazing with the steak excellent service, great value for money, amazing experience.
311: Review: Cosy restaurant on a cold night. Service was charming and friendly. Steak very well-flavoured and cooked exactly as requested. Chips very good. Other side dishes all good if a little small. Only criticism is that there are a few too many gimmicks, such as sticking the knives in the table and serving food on slates (I'd really thought London restaurants were over that). Not cheap but good, so we will be back- we want to try some of the cucina poverty options
312: Review: Dopo aver cenato nel locale di South Kensinton, avevamo molte aspettative su quest'altro locale con mix Fassona/Tonno.Aspetti positivi: qualità cibo, abbinamento cibi, ambiente e servizio.Aspetti negativi: carta vini scarsa con vini esauriti, tavolini piccoli.Giusta qualità / prezzo.Ci torneremo.
313: Title: Premium Italian with a warm touch !!

Review: Been here a couples time and service and the quality of food never let down ! The tuna and the T - bone is a NO MISS !!! Restaurants has a fantastic vibe n ambience, service aren't intruding but still on top and professional, just gives the you the perfect place a special date, maître d And floor manager wereVery attentive as we had an anniversary night they surely looked after us ! Will be back again when we in London !!
314: Review: We had heard amazing things about this restaurant and decided to try it out. We took our 6 year old boy with us and what can I say the staff we're more than accommodating. My little boy had the pasta which tasted amazing!My husband and I had the fillet steak with a selection of sides followed by the most amazing cheesecake! Cannot fault one part of our experience here!! Would highly recommend and as for the price, I would pay double to eat that food again! You get what you pay for & the food was of highest quality.
315: Title: Super Tuna & Sublime Steak....Relaxed Surroundings

Review: We visited for a New Years Eve late lunch as a party of seven.The front of house manager greeted and seated us in a very friendly manner.We loved the surf and turf "concept". Tuna and Steak is a great combo.The idea is to have sharing platters to fully enjoy the experience. We went for it. With some very drinkable red and white wine.A superb meal in relaxed surroundings.Happy to recommend to anyone.
316: Review: We booked here as a Christmas treat for ourselves, staff were very inattentive, one girl just wandering about, had to ask to be served several times, had to ask where the rest of our meal was as it didn't come together, we left feeling very disappointed as it was expensive too, we should have stayed to our original plan and eaten at wrights in borough ..... As a restaurant owner I would be horrified if my customers left feeling like we did
317: Review: A friend who works at one of the hairdressers on Exmouth Market booked the table as she had heard great things about the place.Waiters we're friendly though largely unattentative.They had ran out of the Burrata so we had just the heart of the cheese, the starters took 20 mins to arrive, by the time the main meals had arrived 40 mins later we still hadn't received our drinks (which we had ordered on arrival despite asking numerous times)I ordered the rump steak my friend the tuna but our main meals came ten minutes apart, the meat wasn't v warm, the fries and the potatoes oily.Waited ages for the bill, this place is definitely style over substance and very over rated and over priced. Will not be returning.
318: Review: The Steaks and Tuna were outstanding. Fantastic to see the dry ageing in the window and the steaks being cut. Probably the best steak I have ever eaten (and I've had a few!)The ambience was really good, a bit quirky, relaxed and fun. Service was a little 'off the mark' although friendly, we had to ask for missing starters and sidesThe side vegetables were very small portions, not value for money and pretty uninspiringOverall not cheap but a great experience if you want a FANTASTIC steak
319: Review: Our bread basket and starter were wonderful. They didn't have the Burrata which we wanted but the suggested alternative was pretty great too. I opted for the pasta with beef ragu for my main but it was slightly disappointing. I thought with the emphasis on the meat, that it would be outstanding and meaty but it was bang average. The rib eye my boyfriend had on the other hand was outstanding! Could be one of the best steaks I have had in London! Cooked perfectly! He had a side of broccoli too which although rather small was extremely tasty. Generally a great experience, we'll go back and I'm definitely getting the steak!
320: Title: Best meat, wine and service in London

Review: This is the 5th time I visit 'Macellaio', but the first time I visit the branch at Exmouth Market. We were served by the fantastic Simone, honestly the most helpful, funny and sweet waiter you could ever meet. Not only was the meat incredible (it melts in your mouth!) but Simone's help and service just made everything a 5 star experience. Every time I go I ask myself why I don't go more often. Best meat restaurant in London without a shadow of a doubt.
321: Title: The best steak I had in years and the tuna was outstanding!

Review: What a fantastic experience we had at Macellaio RC!Our waiter, Simone, was very knowledgeable and very nice, the sommelier not too pushy and not trying to sell us the most expensive bottle, which I really appreciate.We had the tuna tartare and meat tartare as a starters, they were perfect and the right size. We then had the fassona steak, which was out of this world. Great service, not too expensive, very caring and attentive service without being intrusive/pushy. This is probably our new favorite Italian restaurant!
322: Review: Part of me doesn't want to write a review for this place in case it becomes any more popular! I honestly can say I had one of the best meals of my life here. The concept is simple: that tuna and steak can both be prepared in the same way. Starters are tuna or beef carpaccio or tartare and mains are steaks...tuna steak or beef steak. We (two of us) had the tuna and beef tartares to start with and then the beef steak for main. Both tartares were delicious. I'm a bit of a steak fiend and the steak...beautiful. So full of flavour and perfectly cooked. And because the meal was just delightful I was sure we wouldn't be disappointed by the basil panacotta. I was right - it was the perfect way to end such a delicious meal. We went as a couple on a Friday night and were seated without having to book a table. It was at the end of summer so the outside tables were all taken up but the inside has a lovely rustic ambience and was lovely too. For two of us I think the meal and a bottle of wine was less than £100 which I'd be more than willing to pay over and over and over again - I was in food heaven.
323: Review: Went here for a birthday dinner and it didn't disappoint. I wanted somewhere a bit different and this place was amazing. Sophistication with a twist. The food was delicious, atmosphere great and the staff very helpful and friendly. The carpaccio's of beef and tuna were delicious then had the beef and tuna steaks which melted in your mouth. Had a great bottle of wine recommended by the barman. Will definitely go again.
324: Review: Locale carino e accattivante, non ci si sta larghissimi e sui tavoli bisogna un po destreggiarsi quando vi sono piu' portate, il che ne dovrebbe fare un ambiente rilassato. Meno rilassato il personale, in giacca e cravatta che recita una noiosa cantilena riguardante la loro proposta degustativa, va benissimo.Anche i prezzi sono in giacca e cravatta, per cui le aspettative crescono, il che va bene.Siamo in 4, prendiamo 4 antipasti da condividere, ci viene suggerito di fare mix and match cosi da assaggiare tutto ma le porzioni sono da nouvelle cuisine. Carpaccio e entrecote di tonno squisiti, una antipasto con agnello (che io non avrei scelto, gusto personale) e un vasetto con forse salsa tonnata (non l'ho scelto io e non ho capito bene cosa fosse). Risultato antipasti, due ottimi e due mediocri che quindi si annullano.Carne, ci viene consigliata bistecca da 1,2 Kg essendo in 4, ci viene presentato il pezzo e noi accettiamo. Qualita della carne buona, cottura, temperature servita, buona.Finale il dolce: preso una crema di basilica che, personalmente, ho trovato un po stuccante, tiramisu presentato in un vasetto perche' probabilmente non avrebbe avuto nulla altro di speciale.Conclusione, antipasto non convincente, carne ok, dolce deludente e, se c'e' una cosa che odia il cliente, e' mangiare un dolce che non sia secondo le aspettative, e' l'ultima cosa che rimane impressa del locale.P.S.Era un sabato, probabilmente provero' Il Macellaio a South Kensington.Comunque rimane un parere personale condiviso con i miei commensali.Aggiungo che, una volta seduti al tavolo, viene offerta una bresaola che e' squisita.
325: Title: What a wonderful night! 5 stars no doubt..

Review: What can you add when something is just "home".. So if you want to be safe, come and find shelter...come here! You won't leave disappointed, from the welcome to the goodbye and trust me..you will look forward to come back! Thanks a lot to Walter and all the team (Specially Giorgia!!!)
326: Review: Great food with excellent service provided by beautiful, helpful and smily Georgia. The cheesecake melted my heart. I will definitely reccomend this restaurant to all of my friends!
327: Review: Best steak in London!!great service and beautiful atmosphere!!try the tartar with gorgonzola cheese!
328: Review: I just can't think how many times we stopped to stare at the restaurant's window. Last week, we wanted to have a nice meal at a nice restaurant and I said to my bf "let's go the restaurant with the tuna at Exmouth market". We glad we did because the food and service was excellent. I must say that the steak is not one of my favourite dishes, but I loved it. We tried a few starters as well, including a tuna carpaccio which was devine. Will definitely be coming back again! Highly recommended!
329: Review: I've been here few times now on different occasions and I can only say that this place is my favorite one. The food, the service and the atmosphere are just outstanding.I highly recommend this place for either business or pleasure lunch and dinner.You won't be disappointed
330: Title: Great steak and superb service

Review: Walking the street looking for somewhere to eat for the evening, we walked past this place initially thinking it was a butchers open late. Further inspection we noted it was a restaurant and had to try, so glad we did. The service was impeccable from the moment we walked in. The waiter recommended some tapas style starters which were delicious, followed by the main event, a perfectly cooked rib eye steak on the bone served with spinach and broccoli sides, accompanied by a very nice red chosen by the waiter. The novelty of beef and tuna maturing in the window only added to it.
331: Review: Brilliant welcome and attentive but unobtrusive service. Great atmosphere and incredibly tasty food. The information and friendly advice about choosing from the menu and wine list was spot on. Thoroughly recommended.
332: Title: molto buono, ma quantità scarsine

Review: Ottima cena, ottimo vino, ottimo servizio. Personale cordiale. A livello di quantità però...tutto molto piccolino, anche se di ottima qualità.Unica pecca? nel giardino interno, quando non c'è piu nessuno arrivano i topini di campagna...ad alcuni non fa nulla, però forse per un ristorante non è un ottima cosa..anche perchè il giardinetto interno da direttamente sulla porta della cucina.
333: Review: Very helpful staff who recommended which dish to order. Very satisfied with the service and of course the steak! Yums!
334: Title: Décevant !!! Pour un prix exorbitant !!!!!

Review: Beaucoup de tralala pour une côte de boeuf, très bonne, mais surtout hors de prix.Pas d'accompagnement compris dans le prix de la viande !! du jamais vu. L'accompagnement est en supplément et en quantité oméopathique...Une belle facture pour ressortir avec la FAIM.... dommage !!! Nous avons passé 4 jours à Londres et Macellaio Exmouth Bar remporte la palme de l'arnac !!! A éviter à tout PRIX !
335: Title: First Class Food and Service

Review: A very busy and buzzy restaurant. The food was excellent. There were eight of us so we just let the staff decide our starters and our mains were steak and tuna. My only anxiety is that the cost of the wine is steep but maybe that is just the norm for this quality restaurant.
336: Review: the service is great: the waiters and manager also took really good care of us explaining food and wine features, and they really know abt it! But most of all the meat was absolutely first quality, perfect cooked, juicy and tender... the price absolutely worth! I am gonna definitely get back asap REALLY RACCOMANDED
337: Review: My friends and I had dinner at Macellaio Exmouth Market for birthday, after a surprise organised by them with the help of Walter, the manager of the restaurant. What can I say...from start to finish it was a fab experience! The food was DELICIOUS, the service EXCELLENT and the venue and the wine topped it all up! I can only advise you to pay them a visit! Never disappoints!
338: Review: I have been at Macellaio a few times and it is always a great pleasure. Definitely the best meat I ever tried in London, highly recommended Tagliata Nuda, so simple and tasty. This time I also tried the tuna stake and it is amazing! Great service, the staff is very welcoming, professional and fast
339: Review: The beef and tuna on offer here are excellent quality which allows them to be served very rare. The absence of lots of dressing or sauces means the taste of the beef and tuna is mouth-watering. The wine we had was very smooth and the grappa of excellent quality. I was a guest so not sure about the price. Service was very helpful and provided good advice. The best steak I've has in London and probably cheaper than most.
340: Review: Amazing steak and tunaBeen there few times now and it becomes my favourite restaurant in town.Welcoming and professional staff always providing an outstanding service.Please try tuna carpaccio, beef tartare and battuta with flambed cheese on top.Then 5 weeks dry aged beef Top !
341: Review: I went here this evening after walking along Exmouth Market while staying at the nearby Holiday Inn. I wish I hadn't bothered. Over £60 for 1 person for a starter, main course and a small glass of red wine. The starter was a tiny piece of tough lamb. I gave feedback to the waiter as he removed my plate and the answer was "ok", nothing more. For main I had the steak. To be fair it was a very good piece of meat, well seasoned and cooked rare. The problem was that it was served on a freezing cold skillet and was cold itself (again the waiter came over, put his fingers on the skillet to confirm what I told him and then left). The meat was served with side dishes of spinach and roast potatoes with herbs, actually undercooked deep fried potatoes with no herbs anywhere to be seen. All in all a really poor meal. At some £61 then I would rate it as without doubt the poorest value meal I have had in a very long time.
342: Title: It never lets you down!

Review: There's nothing more I can say, everytime I go to London, eating at Macellaio RC is a MUST DO. Whatever you order, it's a sublime experience!

Experienced and friendly staff as always!

Hope to see you soon again!
343: Title: Best meat ever in London

Review: Me and my partner went there on a busy Friday night without reservation, place was packed and they offer us to wait 30 min at the bar for a table, fair enough. After 2 minutes a waitress comes with a mouthwatering bresaola and focaccia as welcoming from the house wowWe had a raccomandation from the bartender and we had 2 beautiful glasses of wine.At the table we had suggestion from the waitress and we went for rolling head, stracciatella, ceviche and gorgonzola tartare, outstandingAs mains tuna steak with strawberries and beef rib on the bone, the best I haver had in my life with home made chips. Cheese cake at the end was another great surprise. Very hight attentions at details from managerCant wait to bring there my family all and friends.#Enjoy
344: Title: Disappointed - nice decor, overpriced food and wine

Review: This place looks lovely from the outside and the inside also promises a lot BUT the portion size was tiny if ordering the tapas, and actually not very good, and the wine was very overpriced, particuarly if just buying two glasses of house for lunch. I also have a suspition the bread we were served was a day old - should have complained but we were in a hurry. Would not recommend.
345: Review: Il locale è carino, il discorso del tonno che incontra la fassona piemontese potrebbe essere interessante se non fosse altro che c'è uno squilibrio tra i piatti di carne che sono molto buoni e quelli a base di tonno che peccano o per la qualità della materia prima o per la cottura. Rimandato alla prossima volta!
346: Review: went in the middle of Saturday afternoon when only a few other diners in but given a very warm welcome. The ageing beef in the cold room by the entrance looked wonderful. starters of beef carpaccio and steak tartare were spot on and then we shared a 400g ribeye which tasted as good as it looked. the knives were sharp too! See the photos. All accompanied by a recommended Montepulciano. Plenty of tap water - no charge - was replenished without asking several times. Cannot recommend the experience enough and for fellow northerns it is only a 5 minute cab from Kings Cross!For me a real 19/20, superb and thoroughly recommended!
347: Review: Ristorante molto carino in una via pedonale di londra. Una volta varcata la soglia capisci subito lo spessore dell'offerta. Quarti di carne disposta sul bancone il cui colore rappresenta già una garanzia. Io ho mangiato, nelle due sere in cui sono stato, solo carne; pare tuttavia consigliato anche il tonno rosso proveniente dal mediterraneo. Giudizio assolutamente positivo sia sulle portate che sul servizio. Un encomio particolare a federico che, essendo da solo seduto al bancone del bar, mi ha tenuto "compagnia" nel corso della serata scambiando due parole e facendomi, altresì, scoprire un'etichetta di greco di tufo tra le migliori mai provate. Assolutamente consigliato.
348: Review: We went there with friends for diner; manager has a large fake smile and is pushing you to order as much food as possible. Then we did not want to order another bottle at the end so asked for 2 glasses of red wine. £12 each on the bill.... food is good (though not enough), but it feels as they just want to get as much of your money as possible...sad
