349: Review: beautiful authentic italian restaurant in exmouth market area. quality and athmospere are top notch! the meat comes from piemonte while the tuna from sicily - and all well presented in different tapas dishes. list if wines also very good.quality- price is fairi would recommend a visit
350: Review: Had a dinner at Macellaio with my girlfriend yesterday. There is a great atmosphere and food was fantastic, expecially for the wide selection of starters, called Cicchetti, and the Costata steak was excellent. Definitely will go back to Macellaio next time!!
351: Review: From the moment Anita slammed the steak knives into the tabletop I knew it would be a pretty good dinner. The steak was amongst the best I've had. The Tuna was a real eye opener, treated like a true meat brings out an unexpectedly fantastic flavour and sensation.
352: Review: Quando passo per Londra questa è una tappa fissa!!! Una garanzia!! Servizio al top.. ragazzi molto preparati e gentili!Carne e tonno sempre ottimi!!Continuate cosi!!! Bravi
353: Review: We popped into Macellaio on our way home through London. It was quiet generally in Exmouth Market, maybe because it was the coolest day for a while. So the restaurant was quiet but we really liked it. There is a superb wine list and we chose to eat 'tapas' style small dishes. We chose steak tartare, tuna carpaccio (both delicious), oxtail vaccinara, tuna ceviche, then tagliata with chips and cannelloni beans. There was more than enough tasty food and we were too full for dessert. All the staff were friendly and attentive and we were given a digestif before leaving for home. All in all a very pleasant experience and we would return.
354: Review: Personale Cordiale e Gentile, Piatti Tipici della Cucina Italiana, Servizio Eccellente. La Passione e l'Amore per la Cucina sono sempre al servizio del Cliente che ha la fortuna di fermarsi in questo Ristorante. Ci siamo trovati veramente Benissimo Complimenti !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
355: Review: Great place services all things beef or Tuna.Great wine list too. price is probably on the expensive side but you get what you pay for.
356: Review: It was my birthday recently and we were recommended this restaurant by a colleague of mine at work. As a big fan of Italian cuisine and wine, I had high hopes for this place and boy did they deliver.It wasn't too busy as it was a Wednesday night, but with a lovely relaxed ambience. We were shown to our table by the friendly waitress who explained the concept behind the restaurant and how much to order for the two of us. Then she sent over the sommelier who was very good as he listened to my preferences and then recommended a bottle accordingly. We went for a bottle of Amarone and it was very good.The waitress was spot on with regards to how much to order, between two of us we had three starters, steak for main and three sides, it was the perfect mount, full but not stuffed indeed we had room for dessert.I appreciate people have different tastes but the level of quality here really is something. The beef was like butter even though we had ours served rare and the starters were all amazing (try everything).As a nice finish to the evening we got to meet the owner as he was dining in the restaurant and thanked him for a wonderful meal, he even offered us some complimentary limoncello to finish off a lovely evening.I would highly recommend this restaurant and I am sure we will be back soon!
357: Title: A fantastic dining experience, the best of the best steak you'll ever have!

Review: Wow!!! Macellaio has a cosy unique setting cleverly decorated. The restaurant is relatively small but very comfortable with an air conditioner which really helps during warm summer nights. The owners were very friendly, attentive, and they know their business in depth. A butcher stands by the counter preparing the orders. There was a cue for diners without reservations (luckily we reserved), and some were refused as they were fully booked.We tried the aged ribeye steak and it was amazing - melts in the mouth, the flavour was deep and rich. Pricey but worth every penny. It is comparable to kobe beef, but flavour-wise is still a notch up.Highly recommended, you must try it.
358: Title: Fabulous, steak as it should be!

Review: We followed the waiters advice with regards to portions and had Tuna with chicory and Lamb for starter which we shared, then we had Medium rare beef rib which was incredible, more rare than medium in parts which has now convinced us to try meat a little rarer than we would normally. Followed by Latte Solve Grotto which was amazing, a real sweet treat to end the meal.
359: Review: Had dinner here on a Friday night, arrived a little early so was asked if i wanted to sit outside and have a drink whilst i waited for my friend which I did. After 10 minutes, I hadn't been served so went in to see what the hold up was, they had forgotten about me. Throughout the night, although pleasant, the service was very slow. However, I mark this 4 out of 5 as the simple food is delicious! Would recommend if you are not on a budget, not that fussed about the service but want a good steak!
360: Title: 美味しい、でも一皿が少ない。ワインの品揃えは豊富

Review: マグロの赤身とピエモント牛が一押し料理とのこと。タルタルとかステーキとか美味しいのですけど、お値段の割に１皿の量が少なくて、お腹いっぱいになるためにはお金がかかります（笑）前菜が１人１皿じゃ足りないかも？と思ってしまったくらいです。肉は新鮮で美味しかったです。マグロも美味しかったのですが、日本で新鮮なマグロの刺身を食べなれている日本人にしてみたら、ちょっと身がだれていて今ひとつな味でした。お店の人はマグロを勧めてくるかもしれませんが、ビーフだけにしたほうが失敗がないと思います。
361: Review: I must admit I had been to this place several times and I almoust tried everything on the menu.Both,Tuna and Meat.Since people should find this review helpful, I'd like to give some advice.As a first visit, definetely recommended to share some "cicchetti", small starters that will give you the opportunity to try more dishes on the menu.Personally, I never take a main course. Every restaurant aims to offer an "experience".This restaurant wants to introduce the high quality of their products and to propose a path between fassona meat and wild yellowfin tuna, which are treated and cooked in similar ways.So let Simone, Eugenio and Emilio give you some advice, choose a nice bottle of red wine from their excellent wine list and let yourself be carried away by the marvellous service and the countless shades of red...
362: Title: Loved this place great experience

Review: We went to this restaurant for dinner and has a really good meal,the quality of the food is excellent and they are obviously passionate about the ingredients they use.We loved the Tuna and beef starters and had the beef for main which we shared and it was amazing.We found the staff very informative about the dishes and there was a good atmosphere in the restaurantWould definitely return when we are in London again
363:
Review: Excellent, professionnel, service top, la viande est excellente,
Une très bonne adresse sur Londres 
Le quartier est cool
Félicitations
364: Title: Top notch - surely one of my favourites in London

Review: Top quality ingredients, impeccable preparation, cozy atmosphere and great service is what makes me go back to this restaurant over and over again. I can go to Macellaio for a business lunch with colleagues and clients, for a romantic dinner with my partner or to celebrate a special occasion with friends or family: this restaurant exceeds my expectations every single time! I like to order several dishes and share them with the table so that everyone can have a bit of everything. There are three things though that I just have to keep to myself whenever I visit this restaurant: the beef battuta with spicy gorgonzola, the beef tagliata with pears and balsamico and the tiramisu, AMAZING! A big thank you to Simone and team for making us feel at home every time we visit!
365: Title: Best customer experience ever experienced

Review: This Italian restaurant specialty is articulated around 2 main themeL meat vs. fish. The waiters are extremely polite and skilled. They will present their courses and cuisine culture like nobody else did. Be aware that this is a fine dining restaurant with quite reasonable price and excellent presentation.
366: Title: Great concept, more attention to details required..

Review: I had reasonable expectations about this Italian steakhouse with the ambitious goal of providing also tuna dishes as an alternative to raw beef or standard "tagliata".Prices are much more affordable than the Chelsea branch but they reflect the relatively small portions (tapas-like) they provide. With 25 pounds you will be able to have a 2 course with soft drink and service and it's great value for a steakhouse.Unfortunately there were moments where attention to detail was not at the right standard: the trenette al pesto totally lacked salt (they probably forgot to put in the boiling water) and potatoes bites were raw (whereas they should be slightly boiled). The overall dish was badly affected and the maitre was very apologetic and I appreciated I wasn't charged for it.The tagliata "nuda" (garnished with olive oil) was cooked rare rather than medium-rare and I recall I wasn't asked how I preferred to be cooked when I had ordered it. Eventually I didn't complain as the quality of the meat was very good. As said above, for £8 you can't expect more than half a steak so I'd recommend ordering another type of tagliata or a special not to stay hungry...On the contrary, the "dolce latte fritto" as a dessert was a great find! Creamy and with a hint of chocolate sauce is a must to finish your meal.I have to say I was a little hungry when I left so this restaurant might be more suitable for brunch rather than a full meal...Service was quite friendly and the maitre (or owner?) seemed very passionate about their business, that's a good sign..I am afraid it was an unlucky occasion (still pretty odd because I didn't go in a very busy time) but the potential is clear and the business seems solid as they will open a third restaurant in Southwark soon.
367: Review: Such a shame that I have to write this review, but do beware if you dine here.The decor is gorgeous, the food delicious and the staff are on the main very good.I haven't written to the restaurant to complain before writing this review as the manager on duty was disappointing and uninterested in our complaint.My friend ordered a nice bottle of wine to have with our meal. Once it arrived he noticed it didn't taste the same as he thought it should. He checked the bottle and couldn't see the name of the wine anywhere on the label [Brunello]. He asked the manager if it was the correct bottle and he confirmed it was.He tried the wine again, and asked the manager again- he said it was the right bottle with some irritation.in the meantime, my girlfriend asked a waiter who said he would check and never came back.I Googled the label and then queried the manager a third time and he said he was absolutely sure so I asked him if he would go and check. He came back and this time admitted that it wasn't the right wine 'but it costs the same so don't worry'. I mentioned this wasn't good enough so he brought the wine we originally ordered and said he wouldn't charge for the original bottle after some prompting. Shame as we had finished our meal and it was the perfect wine for what we ordered.Bringing the wrong bottle [and saying the name of what we ordered] is a bad mistake, but after querying three times it just smacks of being lied to [whether to cover up the original mistake or not, it's so disappointing], and being lied to three times is just not on.I had to ask to take the service charge off [his service not the others was awful]. So, we had a cheaper bill but it ruined the meal out.Good food, but not worth the hassle of being lied to. Avoid until the address this. You can't relax there if you have to check everything that comes out.
368: Title: Molto Buona la cucina, meno il prezzo!
Review: ottimi piatti, ottima materia prima e personale preparato e cordiale. Unica nota a sfavore il conto, decisamente salato per le porzioni. Complessivamente una buona cena.
369: Title: Top quality food. Beef and tuna expertly cooked (or raw). Delicious.

Review: This is a delightful restaurant in a delightful setting. We have been bemoaning Kings cross as an area for so long and then by accident came across Exmouth Market which is a collection of lovely little cafes and restaurants. This one has a few tables out the front and also a small decked area out the back, which is great for a warm London summer. They clearly know what they are doing with beef and tuna which dominate the menu, along with an extensive wine list from independent producers for different steak done-ness. The food really blew us away - especially the smaller dishes actually, such as the carpaccio, battuta and stracciatella (heart of mozzarella with tuna roe - sounds odd but was perhaps the best dish). The guy running the place was genuinely interested in making recommendations and checking things were ok. The only surprising thing for me was that the beer choice was limited - mainly 3 German options which I didn't understand. But maybe I am a heathen?!I would love to go back, and with more people I would share the ribs (which is a minimum order of something like 500g).
370: Review: I love the quirky idea of having a restaurant in an old butcher shop.We came in for dinner and absolutely loved it. The service is impeccable and the meat is cooked with attention and care. Some people say that the food is overpriced but in my opinion, you get what you pay for and in this restaurant, you get Quality Food and Faultless Service. I am recommending this restaurant to every person I know.
371: Title: Amazing meal, nice vibe, lovely staff...........

Review: Very welcoming busy understated restaurant. We arrived quite late from the theatre and were made to feel very relaxed and not rushed at all. Best steak we've had in a long time and the very friendly, helpful staff provided complimentary delicious tasters for us to try - the steak tartare literally melts in the mouth and is packed full of flavour and the tuna cheviche is also something else, it really is. The carefully selected wine list caters for all pockets and tastes and the Manager is only too pleased to discuss the wines with you - its so nice to see he has a real passion and enthusiasm for his wines and the food he produces. Nothing is too much trouble and we will definitely be returning. [To add a note, I do not agree with a previous review that the food is overpriced..... it is completely fair and reasonable given the quality of the produce... you can go to a local gastro pub and pay the same prices.... I would pay just to receive the service we were met with and staff that actually knew and cared about the food they were serving and the regions the wines came from.]
372: Review: I can't recommend highly enough, staff are superb so friendly and genuine they are truly lovely people. Food is amazing, quality of tuna and beef used is top notch and is treated with true respect, I went for the beef but was persuaded to try various types of tuna by my daughter and I loved it, everything can be eaten on its own or shared, I'm glad there were 5 of us because we got try lots of stuff but I would go again on my own if necessary, it is not cheap but the quality served could not be sourced in the economy part of the supermarket, I feel it is value for money and you feel uplifted by the whole experience, so often you go out for a birthday meal and it is a let down, but this was really special, they had been tipped off it was my daughters birthday so they presented us with a selection of sweets with a chocolate brownie with a candle in, it was a very nice touch. I would definitely recommend a visit I will definitely be going back
373: Review: The quality is absolutely excellent (it is the only pro), but there are some cons: everything is really overpriced (5 £ for a small side and 32£ for a piece of meat are absolutely too much). Service? It is not the best in the city!
374: Title: Looks very normal, but the most Amazing place

Review: One of the best steaks I've ever had. Cooked to perfection, great taste. I'm something of a steak connoisseur and this was a great surprise yesterday. Comfortably better than Gaucho & Hawksmoor. Didn't go for the steak & tuna combo so can't comment on that. Desserts also impressive, we had the cheesecake and the chocolate cake, chocolate cake just edged it. Value for money....not bad. Normal for London, expensive if you're from the North West! Can't wait to go again, solid 5 stars.
375: Title: A heavenly food trip x

Review: From the starters..Tuna Carpaccio..Beef Carpaccio...Battuta with gorgonzola..Fassona steaks..Green beans Hand cut chips Trenette..Pannacotta..Bianco al basilico.Croccante al Caramello this eating experience was a hedonistic culinary dream.A visit is a must Amazing food.Amazing staff..Perfect location x
376: Review: We have been here for the second time and both time we had a marvelous experience from being greeted until we got the bill....Food was well presented and very tasty especially the stracciatella with bottarga if you love cheese and fish you should definitely try it!The restaurant was quite full but we didn't wait long to get our food..which most of time is a good sign that mean kitchen and floor are well coordinated...thank you Walter and all the staff GOOD JOB!!! We will see you soon..
377: Review: A carne cheia de nervos e muito osso. Além de ser cara , as porções de acompanhamento são muito pequenas e só dá pra 1 pessoa comer
378: Title: Wonderful evening out well worth it

Review: From the minute we stepped through the door we were ma to feel like old family friends.  The atmosphere was brilliant and everybody was wonderfully enthusiastic.  The food was simple and divine and the wine excellent.  Really worth the splash out.
379: Title: God saved the Italian restaurant

Review: I went for a lovely lunch on Sunday at Macellaio. What can I said about this restaurant? I have just a word AMAZING, the food is delicious, the staff is friendly and attentive good service and lovely wine.The tartare is my favourite and I tried the rigatoni all'amatriciana with tuna a glass of wine to complite the lunch .I suggest to everyone to try this restaurant the quality of the food is excellent .God saved the Italian restaurant like Macellaio
380: Review: Macellaio specialises in Piedmont's fassone cattle, and tuna ("the steak of the sea"). So it's strictly for carnivores. It also dispenses with Michelin-impressing flummery - tablecloths, napkins, obsequious service. The vibe is free-and-easy; the service attentive but informal, and with attitude - your steak knife is jabbed into the table in front of you, rather than laid by in place. The food: chichetti - Italian tapas - were delicious, especially beef tongue with parsley salsa, and bottarga & stracciatella. After several meat-free weeks, I was ready for the steak, and it did not disappoint. Fassona beef is mature, dry-aged for 5 weeks, and our sirloin was crusty on the outside, rare on the inside, quite lean, but full of flavour - yielding but still with a good meaty heft. Pretty perfect in fact. Desserts were very good as well. There's a good and long, quite pricy wine list, specialising (of course) in Italian wines. But beef's the USP, and it lives up to the hype. Go there, tuck in. But vegetarians beware. The three of us paid about £170 - for three courses plus wine: that's pretty good value for very good food in Central London. We'll be back for more.
381: Review: Carina l'idea di realizzare un menu' speculare di carne e di tonno fresco. Siamo andati in tanti ed abbiamo avuto la fortuna di assaggiare quasi tutto. Le materie prime sono di qualita' altissima e le tartare e carpacci incredibili! Avendo provato anche l'altro loro ristorante (a South Kensigton), sceglierei l'altro. Comunque eccellente..a parte il prezzo , alto, anche per Londra..ma ne vale la pena.
382: Review: found this just passing in Exmouth Market and the waiter was very helpful and explained the menu and advised what to choose we had 3 starters and the steak tagliate but have to say in retrospect we should have ordered more things but bill with 500ml carafe was £75 so not cheap. The food was lovely but tiny portions so home made bread for a £ helped! Steak was beautiful and some dishes novel like the kid terrine came with a kid's drawing. Chianti was lovely but £6 for 2 tiny morsels of 36 month old permesan seemed a rip. Service was excellent and friendly too. If i was rich I would definitely go back here a few times. there's a garden at the back but as someone else said tables are small and for the price i wouldn't like being cramped up so close to people either side of me unless you wanted to chat to your new neighbours as i saw people doing.
383: Review: My partner and I visited the restaurant on a Thursday evening. We have been welcomed by Eugenio that took extreme care of us for the whole evening.At the Macellaio, they only serve Bluefin tuna from Sicily and Fassona beef, a breeding of Piedmontese cows traditionally known for the extreme tenderness and high quality of the meet.The combination beef and tuna might seems weird at the beginning, but Eugenio explained us that actually tuna and beef have quite a lot in common. In fact the tuna is the only fish warm blooded that can be cut in exactly 4 parts like a beef.We were sitting next to the butcher, Francesco, which was cutting and preparing our meat.We started our dinner with bollito croquettes with chocolate and sweet peppers sauce, the beef tartare and the tuna tartare with gorgonzola. Both meet and tuna were so soft that they melted on our mouths, absolutely extraordinary!As a main, we shared the 400 gr sirloin (it was pure perfection) with sides of roast potatoes and grilled vegetables. The steak was charred on the outside and rare inside, absolutely fabulous! The wine list, I would say way above the London average. We concluded our dinner with the basil pannacotta that totally blew our minds!The atmosphere in the restaurant was great, I felt like being back at home in Italy.The whole dinner exceeded our expectations. Now we can’t wait to go back!Grazie for the special dinner ed a presto!
384: Title: Good food quality but terrible service

Review: I booked a table at 9.15pm because an Italian friend came to London and I head great things about this restaurant. As we arrived a few minutes earlier and the table wasn't quite ready yet, the host suggested us to have a drink in their little outside area. We thought that was a great idea. After 9.45 we realized we were still outside and that the host never came to call us. I went inside to ask for our table and she said the table was ready ages ago and apologized about forgetting us outside. Once we were at the table and chose what we wanted we had to wait another 15 min to catch our waiter's attention. He seemed busy but he should at least have brought some water for the table or ask for drinks within 15min. Our experience was just getting worse and worse. We finally managed to order drinks and wine. The wine list was great and the wine we picked was delicious. We had a steak tartare to start and was very lovely but when our steaks came to the table, two of them were undercooked. We ordered them Med-Rare and they were absolutely rare if not even blue, also very chewy. We mentioned to the bar manager who saw us quite unhappy at the time and asked what happened. We explained and he apologized for the inconvenience but didn't do anything about it (offer to recook it for us or any sort os gesture). I felt terrible to take my friend there and have a not very nice experience. We paid for the bill and left very disappointed. Unfortunately not sure I'm ever coming again!
385: Review: I visited the restaurant for a couple dinner. The experience was great from the beginning with the staff very accommodating. They helped us with the menu and gave great tips. Positive experience
386: Review: I went here for lunch. I had high expectations, but was disappointed to realize that the menu consists of essentially just 2 things: Beef and tuna. You can order different tartares and cuts, but there's not much variety to what they offer.I was also disappointed that the non-tuna/beef options (grilled veg, pasta) were somewhat of an afterthought. The grilled veg were not grilled (more marinated and served cold and oily). I had hoped for a selection of meats and sides, but that really isn't what this restaurant is about. It's just all about the tuna and meat.Also, note that the menu is not very clear about what items are. Tartares are very small- ramekin-sized- and we were told they were "mains" sized. Some of us went a bit hungry.I won't return, unfortunately.
387: Review: We had high expectations of this restaurant after reading the reviews. While we liked it, there were a few niggles. The first was being crammed in on a tiny table right up against the wall. There was hardly any room for the large plates the food was served on, and we had to use the table next to us to fit everything on. That was OK until that table was occupied and then it all became an annoying juggling act. The starters were nice but very small - we ordered a lamb dish to share which was just two mouthfuls in size. Expensive per bite! The tuna and beef starter plate was OK but the tuna wasn't anything special. The main course of steak was good - the meat was tasty and cooked well, although a little chewy. The side dishes were very small - we had three to share. They were all overpriced for what they delivered. All in all our meal was OK but on balance, we found the meal was expensive for what it was. The food was pleasant but definitely not very memorable. Would we go back? Probably not.
388: Title: Top marks for everything except service!

Review: We both ordered the tuna tartare to start and beef sirloin as a main course. You can perfectly taste the freshness of the tuna here, however it was a bit overpowered by too much added salt. Was a bit dismayed that they did not have the habit of asking how you would like the tartare prepared as it also might have been slightly too spiced for many tastebuds. Presentation was clean and simple. All you need! You are shown the hand cut steaks before they head off into the kitchen which is a nice touch. Even better is that the butcher is in the same room as you dine and cuts it right in front of you! Another nice touch is as they gave us our steak knives the waitress stabbed it into the table! How fun! Definitely no kids around here though! Sirloin was really perfect and tenderised by their in-house ageing. One of the best I've had in a while in London!The only thing that made the experience slightly disappointing is the service. As we were in more of a side room there was never really a member of staff in the room, only when they would take orders and serve. We had to help ourselves to salt and pepper and wait a while to order more drinks.Overall great dining experience and will come back for the food!
389: Review: The staff was very nice and made really good recommandations. the food was excellent! There was only one thing: the music. it was a little bit too loude and it didn't fi with the atmosphere.
390: Review: There’s a reason I don’t often go for dinner at my butchers and this place reminded me why. The place seemed nice when we walked in but we were led to a small side room which smelled overpoweringly of meat. The room itself was nicely decorated but the smell was quite off-putting and the clickety-clack sound of the order machine going off every minute wasn’t great. Having not been there before we went with their recommendations for starters - tuna tartare and meatballs. The tuna was ok but unremarkable. The meat balls came on a small plate with sweet potato sauce. They were, apparently, seasoned with chocolate which sounded interesting but were just quite dry, lacking in flavour and there wasn’t much enough sauce. We were considering our options at this point, a £22 200g steak which seems quite high soncidering the quality so far so went with the £16 surf & turf (seared tuna & seared steak on horseradish). Small portions (as warned - 90g each) but also cold (so not recently seared). On this evidence we left for a main course of fish and chips up the road. I understand the economics of running a restaurant are hard but this place just didn’t hit the mark for us. The smell in the side room was off-putting and the food wasn’t interesting or solid enough for somewhere that just focuses on tuna and steak.
391: Title: Italian feast on a gorgeous summer day

Review: My friend booked Macellaio for a group of us after hearing good things. Exmouth Market is one of my favourite little pockets of London, so I was happy to go along. It was a lovely hot day, so we sat outside (there were also electric heaters) and enjoyed the start of summer. The wine list was exceptional, the waitress was happy to help us choose a bottle of red and talk us through the rest of the menu. Basically: tuna or steak kind of tapas style so you can all dig in and sample different bits which I always enjoy. The beef was really tender and I enjoyed the selection of pairings it came with, such as gorgonzola and walnut or pear. So yummy. I don't think we were really adventurous in what we ordered, so I'm keen to go back and sample some of the goodies I saw being served to different tables. Quick round-up: something different, quality produce (it comes from a special farm in Italy), reasonably priced, good wine, fab service and nice atmosphere. Also, if you're friends with any pescetarians who love tuna, it's a perfect compromise.
392: Title: Oh but this is special

Review: A very casual setting - a warm greeting from our waitress - a small newspaper for a menu. A good start. Think tapas. Think sharing. Think steak. Think tuna. The three of us shared beef tartare , smoked tuna slivers and beef tongue to start. Melting is the word that comes to mind. The tartare was soft and sharp either capers. The tuna dissolved in the mouth in smoky goodness, offset by the sharp bitterness of rocket. The tongue - so rarely seen these days - was soft and packed with flavour. A good start indeed! For mains we shared a 600g beef steak and a 250g tuna steak, with sides of roast potatoes, broccoli and green beans. A revelation. The steak was almost charred on the outside, rare either, studded either salt crystals - packed with flavour. The tuna much the same. And the potatoes deserve a mention - tiny, crisp, fluffy - flavour all the way. The desserts matched the rest of the meal - good to look at, better to eat. A good selection of wines at reasonable prices - and friendly informal and informational service. Highly recommended.
393: Review: Fantastisk sted, søde serviceminded personale og helt igennem fantastisk mad!Hvis i vil have sublim italiensk mad, så er det stedet at gå hen!
394: Review: Hungry ? That is the place to be !You walk into the place and you think is this it ? But then you are met with a handsome fellow with a broad smile welcoming you in Italian ! And this is where the story starts !The menu is so detailed that you require the assistance of a professional waiter who is more than willing to explain every item on it .If you are a meat lover , you are in your own playground . The meat is cut according to your order and what succulent taste you will experience . My meat tatar was the best I have ever had !The wine list is so rich that you could choose from special vineyards that go with your special meat .Service great and good value for money !Cheers and enjoy !
395: Title: Excellent experience for steak lovers

Review: Beef comes directly from a farm in Italy.
This is a great and genuine place where to have a proper steak accompanied by a great selection of wine.
396: Title: They know what they're doing!

Review: We came in late but were still able to order. From start the service was good and the food was as good. This is the kind of place you want to visit.Got 1/3 bottle of wine, steak with side order and starter for 48£, which compared to Norway is so good.A nice evening!
397: Review: ci sono stato in famiglia per cena. Location graziosa e accogliente. Servizio medio. Non premuroso, ma neanche disattento. Forse un po' stressato. Tempo medio di attesa per le bibite eccessivo - siamo stati oltre 20 minuti senza neanche un bicchiere d'acqua - . Carne buona, ma non eccezionale. Prezzo alto, ma in linea con la tipologia delle steakhouse londinesi. Non ci tornerei, perché c'è tanta scelta a Londra che mi piace assaggiare carne in altri luoghi. Qui, alla fine, non mi ha detto niente di particolare.
398: Review: I specifically asked for medium rare to rare (I expalined I always get rare) they recommended MR and it came out with a slither slightly pink the rest well done! Discraceful for a 22 pound steak and specialising in steak! V disapointing. No discount on the bill either!
399: Review: Fantastic experience real Italian food with passionate staff, presentation of each dish were so modern and cool. Gotta try the sirloin and the mix carpaccio. At the end basilic panna cotta just blew my mind !!!
400: Title: A bit of a pilgrimage

Review: You have to be a disciple of the art of minimalist protein of the highest order.The tuna and meat are of the highest quality and the service is superb, but it's not a place to go for a fun "steak dinner"Everything we ate was beautiful (if a little under seasoned) and the oil, vinegar and condiments on the table are of very good provenance.We weren't hungry, thankfully. But it's not the sort of place you go for a "blow out"All in all, glad we went, good experience, but it'll be a while before we would go back. There is just so much competition in London now for interesting dining.
401: Review: The experience at Macellaio starts with getting a good table..as some appear rather "close quarters". We managed to change to a better one than offered while still early evening before it got too busy.Onto the eats. The beef dishes are just superp. ..we had the wafer thin beef carpaccio ..melt in mouth to die for ....and a 400g sirloin main..which was quality aged ..cooked to perfection..with the subtle crunchy salt a perfect compliment in both.The 500ml wine (asked for their recommendation)..was a smooth, if pricey, medium bodied Italian red...and worked v well with the food. An average veg side complimented.NOW..in our opinion the tuna starter and main, did not match up to the quality of the beef in taste..both tuna dishes we had were rather average but i wondered if this is because tuna has a more subtle taste and when you start mixing the dishes..pallet confusion! In my opinion the tuna may need more inventive culinary treatment to stand its ground....for example..cook with garlic, chilli., pepper...and possibly some overlay of veg would have helped..perhaps asparagus or spinach ? ....otherwise perhaps advice might be stick to one or the other. After loosing the battle with my companion to have the cheesecake, we ended up with a very average small pastry tart...which need not have been as small. On balance this was quality food experience with attentive helpful staff. Expect to pay a premium price ..near or into a 3 figure sum for 2, which in part can be justified by product quality and location. However in my opinion only the beef truly justified the high markup.
402: Review: The service and the quality of the food are really high! Prices are on London average. Same quality level you can find in Italy.
403: Review: Both Really enjoyed our meal very welcoming friendly staff lovely food can't say was the best steak I've ever ate but was definitely up there for all meat lovers this place is totally worth checking out
404: Review: Tout est parfait dans ce restaurant: service tres agreable et nourriture exquise.Nous avons debute ce diner par des entrées a partager: les eggs sont incroyables, la burrata succulente!Et que dire du "sirloin", parfaitement cuit!On y retournera avec grand plaisir!Foncez, vous ne le regretterez pas!
405: Review: Ottima location, anche se preferisco personalmente quella di South Kensigton. Ottima carne e perfetto tonno, la novità di questo ristorante. Prezzi elevati ma questo si sa!
406: Title: SE LO PROVI TI INNAMORI!

Review: Già dalle vetrine esterne il cliente viene accompagnato ad addentrarsi nel mondo della Fassona e del Tonno rosso. Cibo ottimo, freschissimo, conservato in celle a vista. Tartare deliziose ed affettati dal gusto ricercato come antipasti, come secondi tagliata di Fassona, superba, ma il cuoco supera sè stesso con un'innovativa e magnifica tagliata di tonno. L'ottimo vino "Manolibera" è sicuramente all'altezza di queste deliziose pietanze e le valorizza a pieno. Doverosi ringraziamenti a Fabrizio Walter che hanno saputo trasmettere l'amore e la passione per ciò che fanno per quello e alla nostra magnifica cameriera Marta!
407: Review: I can't believe how disappointing Macellaio RC Exmouth Market was. We booked online for 4 people at 9pm on Friday 1st April. Seriously, how many people would be having a dinner at 9pm? The reason why we booked for 9pm is because we wanted to have a quick drink + nibbles after our dinner at a different restaurant. We sat down and started off ordering a bottle of wine with 2 sharing plates. A manager came by and asked us to leave the table and sit outside the garden.... It was bloody cold and raining. The reason was because they had another group of 4, whom haven't booked, and were wanting to dine in. I couldn't believe how cruel they treated us - reason being is that we only ordered 1 wine and 2 sharing plates. We complained and they said "well, it's our restaurant and we can do whatever we wan't". SERIOUSLY? I'm never ever going to go back again. Very poor service and business.
408: Review: If you are looking for juicy and tender dry aged meat, this is the place to be! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and helped a lot with their recommendation. We ordered the Bistecca fiorentina medium rare. It was just fantastic: tender and red but not bloody. You shouldn't miss the tiramisu either.
409: Review: meat with panache. strong emphasis on their core products, without being pretentious. If you like excellent raw meat with raw, earnest rigour, this is the place to get your flesh down. It opens late and has charmingly earnest staff with matching beards to chat about the food with. Well worth a visit for the attention to detail on the meat, and the enjoyable vibe enhanced by some great Italian wine.
410: Title: What is all the fuss about

Review: The meat beef and red tuna str good but not exceptional besides The meat was overcooked for us even after insisting a lot on the way we liked it - service ok - wines ok but expensive on a per glass basis 8-14£ a glass - lots of other places have good aged meat for better. Shame
411: Title: Freschezza e alta qualitá tutta Italiana!!!

Review: Mi ci ha portata un'amica una sera...non ci sono mai stata e non conoscevo il posto.Locale piccolo, rustico e alla mano. Personale gentile e sorridente.Ho apprezzato le vetrine del Ristorante, dove su una c'era esposta un tonno e l'altra le mezzene, che teoricamente dovrebbero essere le celle frigorifere stesse.Abbiamo condiviso alcuni cicchetti misti fra manzo e tonno (tartare, tagliata di tonno e Tagliata di manzo).Premetto che non ho MAI mangiato una tartare o carne cruda, perció non avevo idea se potesse piacermi o meno.beh...ora che le ho assaggiate, le ADORO!La carne di manzo e tonno sono di qualitá e freschissima! inoltre, all'occhio hanno quasi lo stesso colore (dettaglio importantissimo che conferma la freschezza del prodotto)!abbiamo avuto modo di provare la tartare di tonno e manzo al naturale, condite solo con sale pepe e olio, e credetemi erano Sublimi! Provate anche la beef tartare con il gorgonzola (per chi piacciono i gusti piú decisi)...mmmmmmmmmm che bontá! :PPoi la tagliata di tonno con fragole e aceto balsamico...lo so, lo so...la combinazione é strana ma fidatevi che merita tantissssssimo!!Perció andateci e Buon Appetito :DPS: l'unica pecca é stato il dolce...mi pare si chiamasse dolcelatte fritto... :/dovrebbero rivederlo o farlo in modo diverso...peró immagino e considero che l'obiettivo del locale non siano i dolci ovviamente....
412: Title: It was a best stake ever i eate in my life

Review: Excellent place! Good service! And a vary tasty eat!!! All dishes were anazing: stake, tuna, potato, dessert, wine! 
All of it !!!
413: Review: We were a party of four and looking forward to an authentic Italian tuna and beef experience. We put much of our choice into the hands of our server, Emilio, and he did an outstanding job - in terms of both food and wine.It was very much a sharing experience so we could sample a good part of the range on offer. Wafer thin tuna carpaccio, smoked tuna and dried tuna with homemade focaccia bread. Top quality and mouth-watering. The main course, a 900gm sirloin, with sides shared between us was one of the finest pieces of beef I have eaten. And, finally, a sublime cheesecake of such lightness and texture that completed a wonderful and very memorable evening. Buonissimo...and we'll be back.
414: Review: Once you arrive you straight away feel the difference they offer: great atmosphere, top professionalism, incomparable food! The staff is ready to give an excellent wine and food pairing due to a very high knowledge of their products.It is definitely my best restaurant!!
415: Title: One of my favourite places in London!

Review: Went there few times already. Great vibe. Makes you feel like you are in Italy! Beautifully decorated. Staff is very friendly with a good knowledge of their products. And of course the quality of the food and especially meat is exceptional! 

Highly recommend!
416: Review: I went al macellaio with my best mate.we decide to pick this place in particularly because we were craving some really good meat and tuna!we had some "cicchetti " as a starter and croquette then as a main tuna carpaccio and the beef tongue.the service is been really attentive and i would say perfect value for all the experience . We will come back really soon! can' t wait to pick something else from the menu even if the beef could be again my best dish on the menu!
417: Review: A great place!!!! You guys should try it! I had Steak Tartare, Piazzoiola Carpaccio, Tuna steak and beef sirloin!!!! Everything was amazing. Great service!!! Top place in London!!!!
418: Review: We went last night at macellaio because we heard about it from friends and what they told us was not enough to describe how wonderful this place is, great atmosphere, knowledge staff and very friendly, fantastic value and food is unbelievable amazing. We had cicchetti to start with, beef carpaccio, tuna catalana, stracciatella cheese and battuta with gorgonzola, out of this world !!Then 600gr sirloin steak, the best steak I ever had, with few side dishes.Cheesecake at the end an extra point.Our waitress was so helpful explaining the menu and she did the selection for us, perfect timing and great house wine.Highly recommended
419: Review: I've been there a few days ago with a couple of friends for dinner... and I'm sure when I say we'll hardly forget it.The place looks gorgeous.Every dish was delicious, and I fell in love with the "battuta gorgonzola"... if you go there, don't miss it... otherwise you'll regret it for the rest of your life!!!Regarding the service... everybody was friendly, well mannered and very quick!!!A really good-value restaurant!
420: Title: Warm and Friendly Italian meal with remarkable meat and tuna.

Review: Macellaio is one of the few places in the area that offers delicate meat and sublime tuna fish cooked according to the best Italian tradition. I have been there a few times with friends and and we have been surprised that the butcher allow you to select the meat before cooking it. In addition they have a wide selection of fresh dishes and, to my knowledge, it is the only place in London where to find fresh Sicilian tuna. Highly recommended!
421: Title: Below expectations - would not recommend

Review: The restaurant itself is very nice, well decorated and nice location.I booked a table one week in advance, the restaurant called me 2 hours before to ask me if we could move the booking to 30 minutes later. No biggie so far. But when we finally arrived at the restaurant we had to wait 20/30 minutes more for someone to come and get our order. The waiter brought us a little plate of cured meat and a bit of bread to make us wait (for 7 people).Then the waiter mixed up our orders, forgot to bring one dish of pasta, and then brought the other dish of pasta 15 minutes after everyone had been served with their main. Which means that one of the person was waiting for 15 minutes with no food.Waiters were welcoming and trying to be helpful. But service was not acceptable. we had to ask 5 times to get a jug of water for the table.Would not recommend this place if you want to eat a good main, Cured meat and cheese would be ok to go for.
422: Title: The waiter didn't really care customers feedback!!!

Review: we walked into the restaurant at 5:30pm without reservation. We were given a table and said must return by 7pm which was fine by us as we have plans. The restaurant was pretty much empty. It took 30min for starters to come, it was needing a bit more seasoning and portion were small. We ordered steaks to share and when it arrives, the so-called steak knives were blunt, probably the waiting staff were more focused on how to place the knife on the table their its actually purposes. Steak was fairly tasty, however everything was a disappointment. When our waiter asked hows our food, we said it needed more seasoning and apart from steak everything was average. The waiter just said ok and walked away.. obviously didn't really care what we said and probably won't feed back to chef. One of the worst dining experience in London. Will not recommend anyone to go there with the service and its price tag.
423: Review: amazing beef, fantastic food! Friendly! Great ingredients!We love this restaurant! Superb Quality!The carpaccios are to die for and all the mains we have tried, from pastas to the beef by weight, and salads are superb!
424: Review: The food here is absolutely the best, The steak has only ever been bettered for me in restaurants charging twice the price (when I wasn't paying) or overseas. The tuna is a revelation. Very friendly and helpful waiting staff too. The only downside is the music was playing too loudly to talk very easily.
425: Title: Excellent steak and tuna, shame about the sides

Review: We shared 3 of the tapas between us - smoked tuna, carpaccio of tuna and beef bresaolo with parmesan and all were very good. 3 was probably the right number for 2 people.We shared a 600gm steak, rare, and it was really tasty and just the right size to leave us feeling full, At £16 a head I'd say it was excellent value given the quality of the meat.The only sour note was the side dishes - hand cut chips and caponata - which were both very good but tiny portions for a fiver a go.With no dessert, two coffees and a £30 bottle of win we paid near enough £100 for two, and I reckon that was good value for what we got (even with the tiny sides!)
426: Title: NON UNA CENA BENSÌ UN'ESPERIENZA CULINARIA

Review: Per la seconda volta a Londra negli ultimi due mesi , alla ricerca di un posto dove mangiare bene e trascorre una serata diversa io e la mia cara amica ci imbattiamo in questo adorabile ristorante ( affollato al punto giusto per una domenica sera ). Accolti dal Manager in charge (più tardi abbiamo scoperto che si chiama Eugenio) veniamo "presi per mano" ed indrodotti in un fantastico mondo fatto di Fassona e Tonno rosso. La percezione di questo posto è stata a dir poco straordinaria. La qualità del cibo unica. La passione che le persone che ci lavorano dentro riescono a trasmetterti...qualcosa di introvabile ad oggi. La lunga "chiacchiera " con la quale Eugenio ci ha onorati a fine serata ci ha fatto scoprire il mondo del Macellaio Roberto Costa a Londra . Volete sapere qual'è il loro ingrediente segreto??? La passione infinita !!!3 antipasti ( il tonno con la cicoria bianca da urlo, fatto anche il bis) una bistecca di carne da 400 grammi ..una tagliata di tonno che si scioglieva in bocca, contorni,dessert , vino (un Portico Rosso che vi consiglio vivamente) digestivi , tutto questo per un prezzo più che resonabile considerato che siamo a Londra. Che dire ....abbiamo trascorso una serata fantastica.Ecco come una cena si può trasformare in un'esperienza culinaria....!!!!!Grazie Eugenio a te e a tutto il tuo TEAM.SIETE FANTASTICI! !!
427: Title: Very expensive and not great quality

Review: The sirloin steak was served very cold and had to ask the waiter to take it back to warm it up. The meat was dry and not particularly tasty. Wine was ok but very overpriced. Chips were nice. We spent nearly 170 pounds in two just to share a big steak, a bottle of wine, 2-3 starters and some very small shots of Italian spirit. All portions were very small. The only very good thing about the place was the service and the atmosphere but I wouldn't go back.
428: Title: Good meat but be prepared to be ripped off

Review: My friend and I wanted to have a sit down lunch instead of gran and go at Exmouth Market and we saw the advert outside this place Lunch Menu £12.90. So we thought it wasnt too bad. Menu is complicated and pretentious to be honest, but we've ordered starter and main, and glass of red - the cheapest on wine menu which was £6.50! And believe this place is not Grosvenor. It is very tiny and scruffy which I supposed should be part of the charm. The beef in the main course was tasty although expect gourmet portions. The starter however was a disappointment - I ordered prosciutto with cheese and instead of traditional cured ham I received something what looked and tasted like luncheon canned meat. Also the wine my friend chose was out of stock so the waiter offered her a glass of Pinot Noir. To our surprise the bills came at £57! We asked the guy to double check as we ordered the lunch deal, he apologized and brought new one at £54. It turned out the glass of basic Pinot Noir (which was offered as a replacement to the wine they didn't have) was £11! That's more than a bottle of it from next door...also 12.5% service charged was already added to the bill ...we didnt have it in us to argue so we left. And of course we will never come back. It is a short term strategy guys. Happy customer is worth more than short term profit. Hope you will learn it one day.
429: Review: Dovevamo festeggiare la laurea di mio nipote e senza aver combinato quella sera era anche il mio compleanno, che dire scelta migliore non potevamo fareAbbiamo cenato mangiando una carne veramente SUPER cottura perfetta e veramente tutto perfetto personale gentilissimo e cordiale Buona carta vini direi che sarà sempre tenuto in considerazione quando torneremo a Londra Bravi!!!
430: Title: Lovely Steak and Tuna....but a little too pricey for what you get

Review: I've been here twice now with friends for dinner and had various selections of food from the Beef Carpacio, Fasona Beef and Battuta to Capitelli.Don't get me wrong...the food is very good but with good wine this place can set you back upwards of £100 per person which I think we could get a better meal at other top notch london restaurants
431: Title: A perfect dinner concluding a perfect weekend !

Review: .. I know this restaurant very well.. I used to go to the SK branch ! Note: I used to work in a restaurant...! When we arrived I felt a little bit disappointed because we waited to be seated 5 minutes while the waiter did not say anything.. the bartender was just looking us..and anyone.. at the end one guy came ( I realised afterward that there was another room ... where everybody where!) .. We finally seated and the same guy came to explain us the menu...fine and explain us how we could have a nice dinner trying different dishes... at the same time we asked for the wine list ( he did not bring with the main menu..) .. We ordered drinks( that they came after 15 minutes.... and what was really disappointed was that some (probably ) regular customers came after us and in 2 minuted they already had a bottle of wine on the table) and one of my friend ordered as Starter/Main a Pasta dish, and he was told him the past took 15 minutes to cook so maybe was not nice to let us keep waiting.. The way how he said that.. Disappointing ! Despite of that.. the pasta came as first dish in 9 minutes... and we were still waiting the Starters!! :) :) Apart from that... the food is excellent, we loved all the dishes...we had two cicchetti..and then a tuna and a steak tartare... following Tagliata Nuda.. with two sides.. and at the end: AMAZING cheescake and Tiramisu!! Perfect !!A presto !
432: Review: sono stata in questo locale la scorsa settimana, ambiente molto carino e particolare, servizio impeccabile e carne divina. Personale italiano e carne italiana.Non avevo mai mangiato carne così saporita è tenera, anche il tagliere dei salumi molto buono.Il prezzo un pò alto ... Certo se le porzioni delle tagliate fossero un pò piú abbondanti...
433: Review: Dopo essere stato nell'altro ottimo ristorante ho voluto provare anche quello in Exmouth Market. ..Non avevo dubbi...La professionalità e la preparazione dei ragazzi in sala è disarmante...La carne è strepitosa...ma ciò che più mi ha colpito è il tonno!!! Sapientemente lavorato. ..Lo consiglio a tutti quelli che come me sono amanti della carne... credetemi provare un emozione gustando il tonno vi lascerà senza parole...anzi riuscirete a dire...complimenti!
434: Review: We went for a family meal to celebrate my brother's birthday and we couldn't have been happier - fantastic service, atmosphere, decor and the food, well... genuinely some of the best steak and tuna I've ever had. We had a couple of recommended starters and mini-tapas, some were ever so slightly on the small size but they made up for it in taste 110%. The beef tartar and gorgonzola was out of this world. The mains were perfectly cooked and a great size. The wine list is lovingly curated and affordable. Highly recommended all round.
435: Title: Some good and some not so good...a lot of meat!

Review: Don't get me wrong, I love meat but I found that the menu was mostly just meat and tuna (which I don't eat). However, if you enjoy both than you would find the menu most appetising. The raw beef dishes (circle) was very good but the Carpaccio was very plain. The steak was also quite bland and missing flavour. The chips were nice and so were the beans. We didn't order the spinach but they brought it out to us anyway. It was overcooked and not very enjoyable so glad it wasn't something we ordered.It was slightly loud in the restaurant as we were seated next to a large group. The service is friendly and the wines were very good. But it's a restaurant I would go back to as I prefer a bit of variety and it was a bit too much meat and tuna for my liking.
436: Review: That is one thing you will not do is forget this restaurant and butchers it is so authentic, the sharing tuna and meat tapas concept is simple yet so effective, the food is simply to die for. The tuna carpaccio and ceviche just melt in your mouth, as do the rare meat dishes all aged over five weeks, and served as only the best beef from Italy, you cannot imagine how good this food is. Please on your first visit (it won't be your last) make sure you have the waiters give you an overview of the concept and the menu it is breathtakingly good. Can't wait to go back and try the pasta! Also the wine list is exceptional some very decent bottles at very reasonable prices ask for a recommendation we did and it was superb. The decor and hanging fish and meat in the windows is unique and always attracts a crowd. Enjoy you will not be dissapointed.
437: Title: Best tuna and beef steaks ever!

Review: I entered in this restaurant by chance after my eyes got captured by incredible windows showing hanging tuna and beef, very different and creative! We had some starters and tuna and beef steaks, everything super qualitative and tasteful. Definitely the best steak I ever had in my lifetime! Service is also very attentive and friendly, the staff will explain you the story about the food and its origin which shows a lot of passion and care for customers. Nothing else to add, go and try it if you are around, it's really worth it!
438: Review: I wish this restaurant was closer to my place.. I'd probably eat there every day!Been there after eating many times at Macellaio in South Ken, so I was already expecting high quality, but my expectations were (if possible) exceeded. The new tapas concept is brilliant, you can taste and share a little bit of meat and fish starters which are simply delicious. Then the real chef specialty is the duo of steaks, beef and tuna... Their quality and taste will leave you speechless! If you can still eat, tiramisu and latte fritto are the cherry on the cake. Interiors are very well designed, wooden tables and cozy sofas which make you feel like home. The staff and owner are very welcoming and passionate in perfect Italian style.100% recommended!
439: Review: Well...I've been here since the opening and I m still coming when I want to treat myself with good quality food.If you are a meat and fish lover well this is the right place for you, I love the way the meat is processed and cooked it s out of your mind.I tried every single plate of the menu and you just need to pick your favourite one.The service is familiar and impeccable.Well done Roberto!!!!Well done guys!!!
440:
Review: We had the most memorable meal at MRC.  The service is knowledgable and friendly, the meat is fantastic and the cooking first class.

Absolutely recommended.
441: Review: An unassuming looking restaurant with cafe style tables made us hesitate for a moment about staying but so glad we did the food, service and wine were amazing. I usually go for Fillet steak not being a fan of fatty sirloin steaks but the sirloin here was fantastically seasoned and very soft and tender.
442:
Review: If you like good steak and tuna steaks, then hurry here. What a treat. Combine that with excellent service, gteat wine, plus a great there to the restaurant.
Simply superb! Enjoy. We did.
443: Review: Was recommended this gem last minute and cancelled another restaurant to spend our anniversary here post Sadlers' Wells. Perfect choice: warm but vibrant; brilliant food but unpretentious. The service was impeccable and wine well chosen to go with our food. Talking of which, best steak and tuna I've had for years. Highly recommend this place for couples and groups of friends who want something a bit different without compromising.
444: Title: Best Italian Meat (Fassona) and tuna in London...it is not a restaurant is a culinary experience!

Review: I jumped in with my wife and a couple of friends, and OMG this place is amazing. You can have fine and tasty dishes with a reasonable price...Of course you have to be prepared to spend some of the money you usually throw away for a nasty pizza or a burger. This is a place in which you can have extraordinary meat (Fassona) and tuna dishes in an amazing italian style and the prices are good for the quality.
445: Review: Macellaio looks the business. Beautiful hunks of beef sliced to order and displayed to you before cooking, warm decor. Great wine list. Some lovely sliced cured meats. But overall we were a bit underwhelmed. As soon as I arrived, pretty much in the same breath as saying hello, we were told we'd only have the table for an hour and a half. I know restaurants need to have more than one sitting but to be rushed like that immediately, as we came in the door, didn't feel too welcoming (especially as then when we left there were lots of empty tables around anyway..)There's some talk about a 'concept' which basically boils down to 'steak and tuna are both meaty so we serve both of them'. Tune tartare was lovely but a beef carpaccio was underseasoned. Chips were anaemic, spinach overcooked and underseasoned, our steak was ok, a bit overcooked for us (we asked for rare) and was a little dry and underseasoned, which was a shame because it looked so impressive at the butchers counter. Plus there's a lot of nonsense - steak served under kloshes for no reason, sticking your steak knives into the table before your main and again with the bill. It's a lovely looking place with otherwise friendly service and I really wanted to love it, but there are definitely better steak places around and better places to eat on Exmouth market. Overall we were left feeling it was a case of style over substance.
446: Review: Für Fleischliebhaber ist dieses kultige Lokal absolut empfehlenswert. Hier erhält man authentische italienische Fiorentinas die optimal gelagert wurden. Das Lokal verfügt über eine einfache, authentische Einrichtung. Kein Lokal für ein romantisches Date - dafür ein Geheimtipp für einen gehörigen Männerabend.
447: Review: So there we were on route to our annual Christmas treat at Sadler's Wells..Macellaio proved a wonderful place for lunch. This is not your average high street Italian restaurant..it specialises in high quality tuna and beef. We had beef for Christmas so we thought we leave that until our next visit ..with the exception from some delicious beef croquettes.We had tuna carpaccio, then tuna with strawberries and balsamico..and tuna with rocket and parmesan. We relished side orders of small roast potatoes, and borlotti beans with sage butter..We enjoyed two wines recommended to us by the Maitre'd. The food was delicious and healthy, service was extremely good. Highly recommended.
448: Review: This restaurant is amazing! To start off my waiter walked me through the menu and explained everything to me. I didn't even ask for that, maybe I looked helpless? Which I totally was. Based on my waiter's suggestions I got a tuna carpaccio and prosciutto started. Both AMAZING. And a pasta main dish. What I like most about the restaurant is the pricing and the feel. It's not pretentious at all and the pricing is seriously perfect. Plus, I am a very healthy eater and this freshness of the ingredients made this whole meal guilt-free! 10/10 will be coming back. My wallet and stomach will both be happy.
449: Title: Group meat and wine session

Review: Brought our own wines. The meat is absolutely excellent, with choices of cuts presented beforehand. Great attention to detail. The style of cooking the various starters and mains. The filets were sublime and like butter. The rib-eyes all cooked beautifully and flavoursome. The carpaccio and tartare starters were some of the best I've had, though focussed mainly on the heart served with a chilli garlic sauce. All excellent and served with friendly care.
450: Title: Steak under a silver dome.....

Review: Impressive tuna & meat make a great window display .Much over complicating of a simple menu is made by the staff to the point that one of our party was so over come by it they just wanted someone to order for them .I had chopped steak topped with grilled Gorgonzola to begin - fabulous piece of cheese that completely overpowered the beef underneath - after the first bite all I got was cheese on something softWe all went for steak - coming in at different weights / all on the bone which is great but not mentioned on the menu ? & onto to the frankly bizarre serving of grilled steak from under shiny silver domes .I'm sorry but it's a steak ! Anyway it was fine - sweet tender Italian meat but after the dramatic serving maybe I was expecting more than a simple piece of meat can deliver .Terrible caponata - al dente aubergine is something that should never be served & it was neither sweet or sour .Nice potato used in fries .Fried pastry balls stuffed with Nutella were sadly disappointing - ok with a coffee but I'd be a bit embarrassed describing it as a house speciality as they were by our waiter.The bill came in at the region that made me think of other places where I would have paid the same but they would have been-well let's put it simply - better ..
451: Review: I went with a six others and we - perhaps foolishly - asked for sharing platters, thinking it would be a selection of menu highlights. It wasn't. It was the entire menu, including four types of tuna and steak tartare and two 1/2 kilo sirloins on the bone. Everything was beautifully prepared and flavoured and even with half a bottle of wine each the bill was only £75 per head. More than we had been looking to spend maybe, but well worth it in terms of the quantity and quality of food provided and fantastic for a blow-out...
452: Title: Delicious, relaxed, interesting, fab wine

Review: It's hard to describe this place. It literally just serves great beef and great tuna. The menu is a mirror with similar dishes each side and then you pick and choose what you want. The owner / maitre'd (?) was really patient in explaining the set up and the origin of the food and made sure we didn't over order. We had carpaccio of both and they were really beautiful. The sides were limited in choice but delicious, but then that's not really why you would come here. It was a bit disconcerting at first to have a butcher hacking great big ribs of beef on a block in the middle of the floor. I suspect a few blobs ended up on people's plates - but so what, when it's this fresh and tasty! Our only disappointment was the pud (fried milk balls). We should have either shared or not bothered, it was ok but not great. On the plus side,our primitivo was one of the best we have ever had - worth the trip alone. Service was genial and reasonably prompt (although can someone please tell the waiter in the low slung jeans that it's not a good look when you're thrusting your underpants in the face of the diners. Fine for outside - not in the restaurant. he was very charming though!)
453: Review: First time I had dinner at this vintage and excellent restaurant!the dishes were perfect and really tasty!you can enjoy your dinner nu tasting  various dishes of pasta,fish and metà!!the staff was polite and servire flawless!!i recommend it to anyone.
454: Review: The beef and tuna served at Macellaio are amazing. It's a shame the dreadful service ruined our overall experience. The dishes are really small (like tapas). The cost (£8 on average) should have been a hint, I recognise that, but a warning from the waiter could have been better just to avoid the disappointment when you get your food. We've asked for bread, never got it. Two of us got their mains (mine was barely hot), two other got theirs 10 minutes later, and the last of us never got his main. Supposedly they didn't take the order but they brought his side and a meat knife, that makes a lot of sense! The service is barely polite, and smiling definitely an option. The two desserts we got for free to apologise for the invonvenience were not enough to make us forget the terrible (and pricey) experience it's been...
455: Review: Sono stato con amici e familiari in questo ristorante molto particolare..che devo dire?siamo stati benissimo..cibo molto molto buono e atmosfera carinissima..ci ha servito Emilio con eleganza e professionalità..grazie mille x la bellissima e buonissima serata..torneremo
456: Review: One look at the windows and you know this place is all about the ingredients. We loved the yin/yang tuna/beef menu (though it is uncertain how much you need to order). Preparation is kept simple so as to not interfere with the superb meats. There isn't much in the way of sides, so this is really not a place for a true vegetarian. It's rather expensive, but quality meat doesn't come cheaply.
457: Review: Ich War mit ein paar Freunde in Exmouth market in dieses geiles restaurant,, wir haben beide gegessen , fish und Fleisch und beide wahren wirklich super aber das tartare mit gorgonzola War wirklich der hammerAusgezeichneter Wein Empfehlung und am ende ein Tiramisu den auch jetzt noch traumen
458: Review: Been here twice, both times excellent. The steak is amazing. I loved the steak tartare with Gorgonzola melted on top.
459: Review: We turned up without a reservation for a pre theatre meal, we only had an hour to eat and what an experience, The tapas dishes were delicious, the rump steaks and roasted potatoes absolutely yummy. The service was so consistent that we even managed to share a dessert. The frito dulce was heavenly. All in all, one of the best places we dined at in London. We will go back.
460: Review: This is a place for carnivores...with very special cuts of prime meats prepared in their unique way. They have now added excellent Tuna to their very individual menu.Best to share both the starter plates and mains here - portions are very generous. So while the menu may appear pricey at first glance it is actually very good value.Had a unusual tuna carpaccio with blue cheese and a steak tartar followed by a 400g sirloin - cooked medium rare as they recommended which was just great.Nice eclectic wine list - had a excellent value Tuscan red. Service was good, knowledgeable and helpful.
461: Title: Beautifully simple concept which lets the food do the talking

Review: From the moment of booking a table to leaving the restaurant, we could not have had a better experience.Walter and his team were incredibly attentive yet relaxed.The food was simple but soooooo tasty. Bravo!!!We warmed up with a Prosseco which was as smooth as a baby's bum! Lovely! The red wine from Piemonte was a great companion to the steak.We tried a range of starters (Heart of mozerella, tuna carpaccio, steak/Gorgonzola). They were all incredibly fresh and tasty.Now for the steaks! I had a 600g sirloin which was incredible and very well cooked. We shared spinach, roast potatoes and Mediterranean vegetable ( the carrots were the sweetest I have ever had). Bravo#2I am not sweet toothed but the cheesecake was sublime and the pineapple was very refreshing.The wine was good value for money and all washed down with strong espresso and amaretto.This is definitely going to become very popular, so get in quick!
462: Title: Crazy menu until you tuck in

Review: Went with some friends and clients and the mirrored Tuna vs Beef menu looked odd, blue cheese etc, but boy was this some of the best food I've eaten ever. And the £35 bottle of wine blew our socks off, it was amazing. Great place, great staff, amazing food and they air cured Tuna is something else
463: Title: When the waiter is your friend

Review: Twelve of us after quite a few drinks on a Tuesday night rocked up on the off chanceThe waiter took control and seated us all and asked if we wanted him to order for usOption 1. Leave to individuals and take ages to be fedOption 2. Hand over responsibility and eat instantly He ordered for us all and we had all raw starters. Raw tuna and three different raw beef dishesFabulousGoing again this week
464: Review: I had dinner there yesterday night . Informal nice place. Good service and I suggest that , if a table is not available have dinner at the bar. Good wines and excellent meats will be served in an informal way. Potatoes are excellenr and vegetables are superb.Try the Ripasso wine with a steak....
465: Review: Your choices are limited to beef or tuna - both excellent quality. It is definitely a unique food experience, the meat is presented to you before you eat it. Service was a bit patchy but will definitely be back.
466: Review: Forget every restaurant you've ever visited and treat yourself to a unique experience at Macellaio RC, Exmouth Market. In the first instance, the waiting staff are so knowledgable about all the cuts of beef on the menu, identifying the region and the quality of care that produces such delectable meat, and this knowledge extends to the wine list, with regard to the types of wine produced in each region of Italy. If you are a lover of beef then the carpaccio and tartare are to die for. I am going back to try everything on the menu.
467: Title: A Restaurant with a twist

Review: One of the best restaurants I have been to, a new food experience.From the interiors to the food everything was exceptional and delicious. But what makes this place even more enjoyable is the friendly and welcoming atmosphere that each staff member provide from the moment you enter till the very end. We were served by a very professional and friendly waiter who had a great knowledge of the food and drinks which made our dinner just perfect.
468: Review: With massive slabs of meat in the window display it is a carnivore's dream. We tasted a lot of their starters; tartare with gorgonzola excellent, rump with pear slightly bland. Big sirloin to share was good. Service was friendly.
469: Review: The choice is not extensive but as a concept it seems to work.Positives:I really liked the cold rooms with the beef and tuna at the front - it is like sitting in a butcher's shop.I mistakenly ordered the steak tartare without the traditional French ingredients - i.e., it was seasoned and dressed in olive oil - what a revelation that raw beef can be this good with great oil and seasoning. My husband had tuna tartare, this was also excellent.The quality of the ingredients is excellent and the cooked tuna and steak (mains) were also cooked to perfection. I was persuaded to have the potatoes with rosemary rather than triple cooked and it was good advice.Hadn't booked so we waited for a table for 30 minutes and were fed delicious snacks.Staff are welcoming and knowledgeable - I think our waiter should do stand up, very entertaining guy.Negatives:I suppose some people may not like concept restaurants.
470: Review: "This is not a restaurant" our waiter claimed somewhat disingenuously. "It is a butchers with tables". It certainly looks like a restaurant but the conceit is designed to stress the provenance and quality of the meat. Actually, the explanation of the concept which is that they only serve beef and tuna (because tuna is really beef in fishy disguise) wore my patience a little. We were out for a family celebration and wanted to talk to each other not the (admittedly charming) waiter. The menu is confusing but essentially offers the same treatment to beef on the left page as to tuna on the right. You can have both as tartare, both as carpaccio etc. In the middle are the steaks. Impressive and large (400g is the smallest) which we didn't taste but were carried to other tables with ceremony and aplomb. Starting price for a steak was £22. This is a restaurant that celebrates large portions and huge appetites if you stick to the main story.We strayed by tasting the smaller plates and they were fine. Not hugely original or surprising but the beef and tuna were of good quality and not messed about. But the portions were small. A tuna tartare for £8 came as a disc the size of a jam jar top so you need several of them to satisfy even modest appetites; the restaurant's recommendation of 2 per person seemed light. We felt the choice was between a huge steak that felt intimidating or lots of small portions that left us asking for the menu back again.Deserts were poor. A tiramisu was big on cream but light on the base which meant it lacked both texture and taste. A chocolate cheesecake was rich but unremarkable. The bill for four of us including two bottles of wine and three prosecco was £215.
471: Title: A unique and wonderful meal

Review: When I saw the dry-aged beef curing in the window, I immediately knew that I would have to eat here before I left London. Thankfully I was staying right around the corner.Everything was perfect, the staff were friendly and helpful, the wine that the waiter suggested was great, the steak was amazing and the dessert was delicious. I was only in London for 2 nights but this was one of the highlights of my stay. Highly recommended.
472: Title: Grande qualità, qualche errore nel servizio

Review: Abbiamo deciso di provare con alcuni amici Il Macellaio a Exmouth Market, avendo provato anche quello a Kensington. Lo stile del ristorante è lo stesso, la novità è l'uso del tonno rosso di Sicilia. Siamo stati inizialmente sorpresi dai prezzi (più bassi rispetto al primo Macellaio) ma, come ci ha spiegato il cameriere, il locale punta sul menù "to share", che fà assaggiare un pò del meglio. Optiamo per quella scelta quindi e non rimaniamo delusi. Tutto molto buono, mi ha sorpreso la tartare di tonno in particolare. Eccezionale la sirloin steak da 900g, curiosamente buono l'arrosto di tonno. Leggermente deluso dall'amatriciana di guanciale e tonno (quest'ultimo prevale un pò troppo, a mio avviso, comunque buona). Piacevole sopresa, la selection dei dolci. Tutti homemade, davvero buoni, il gelato alla vaniglia e la brownie su tutti (mi ha ricordato un pò la Tenerina ferrarese).In generale, grande attenzione al dettaglio anche nella presentazione dei piatti.Il servizio è scenografico e molto competente, forse un pò troppo "pushy".Peccato solo per il conto finale: due bistecche di tonno e una porzione di patatine che non abbiamo mai ricevuto (onestamente, non ci siamo ricordati nemmeno noi, presi dall'assaggio dei piatti). Cose che possono capitare, come ben sà chi ha lavorato in un ristorante, specialmente in una serata molto busy. Fate attenzione anche ai vini e ai drinks. La lista dei prezzi era stata furbescamente rimossa al momento del consiglio sul vino da abbinare. Lo spritz a 9£ poi (!!!) non lo pago neanche allo Shard.Nel complesso, forse un pò troppo caro rispetto alle porzioni.Molto consigliato per una mangiata di qualità, da intendere più come degustazione.
473: Review: Walked in to smiling, friendly staff and warm atmosphere. Delicious personalised cocktail to kick start the evening! Meat and tuna were to die for – absolutely gorgeous (and some of the male staff aren’t bad to look at either! ;) Great quality – A+ – defo going back!
474: Review: I've been to Macellaio a few times since I found this gem of a restaurantin Exmouth Market and each time has been absolutely fantastic. The decor issimple and authentically Italian which is also a great way to describe thefood. If you like steak and/or tuna, raw or cooked, the food is superb.Fresh, simple, tasty and very very good. The staff are very knowledgeableabout the menu, they know how the dishes are cooked and where the produceis sourced. It drives me crazy when you ask a waiter for an opinion on adish or for a recommendation off the menu and they say they don't know orhaven't tried it. Not the case here! The wine list is very good albeit withan Italian bias (which is to be expected) and the cocktails are fantastic. The bartender is clearly very experienced and just as passionate about wineand cocktails as the kitchen is about it's food. - As I mentioned, I'vebeen a few times already so have had the excuse to try a few fair bottlesof wine as well as the cheeky cocktail here and there.The last time I went was in the early evening and we were offered the barmenu. The waiter suggested the egg and salted tuna dish, which doesn't'sounds like a particularly appetising combination.... Oh. My. Goodness. Itwas absolutely amazing. I highly recommend it.If I had one criticism of the restaurant it would be that the egg and salted tuna dish is not on the dinner menu as well!
475:
Review: I went there on a Sunday afternoon with my friends and we loved it!
