We had the beef carpaccio and the tuna with gorgonzola... amasing! their home made bread is also very good. Good selection of wine as well! I will be back.
476: Review: The selection of food is very accurate and offers great vegetarian options even if it's a butcher, this together with the stunning wine list and the perfect Italian service makes this place a little gem. A bit pricey, but that's easily understood.
477: Review: Ho cenato in compagnia di colleghi in questo nuovo ristorante italiano. Premetto che quando sono all'estero non mangio mai italiano se non obbligata perché ospite, sono convinta che la nostra cucina quando esce dal confine, molto spesso è lontanissima dall'originale.Questa è l'eccezione che conferma la regola!Calorosa accoglienza di personale italiano, ambiente simpatico, un misto tra vintage, riciclato (nell'utilizzo dei materiali) e moderno. Vetrine con vista su cella frigorifera con gli ingredienti principali, tonno dalla Sicilia da un lato e Fassona Piemontese dall'altro, molto originali ma decisamente inquietanti .... I due macellai (i ragazzi adibiti al taglio della carne) vestiti da italiano anni 20 camicia a quadri e coppola, belli e pittoreschi!Cucina a vista ... I piatti semplicemente fantastici! Ingredienti semplici, ma l'altissima qualità e la maestria di Matteo lo chef, fanno si che l'esperienza in questo locale sia stata indimenticabile!Non ho un piatto preciso da consigliare, tutto perfetto, anche l'amatrciana è meravigliosa, equilibrio ed innovazione (per l'aggiunta del tonno) la rendono buonissima!Non perdetevi i dessert ....
478: Title: Great food but very small portions

Review: Very attentive and helpful, but slightly shaky, service - probably due to the fact that this offspring of the Brompton Road restaurant had only recently opened. Portions are very small, which did leave me with a sense of not having had great value for money. The food was good. Carefully explained and presented - which is good since the menu layout is slightly confusing.
479: Title: A little slice of Italy in the heart of London

Review: Macellaio has a very unique character, from the décor right down to the food, it really makes you feel like you've stepped off a London street and into an Italian local. I have been a couple of times now and every time the meat has been cooked to perfection, the fish has been fresh and the staff have been fantastically friendly. Having tried the one in South Ken I was keen to see what the latest edition had to offer and definitely was not disappointed. The quality of the food, the meat and fish in particular, is incredible. The sides are really tasty - they have all the essentials from veggies to roast potatoes to spinach.The starters, I mean, who knew raw meat could be so good? Normally not a huge fan of the raw variety but the tuna and steak carpaccio have me converted (I would highly recommend) - our waiter suggested we try a range of dishes which worked out really well as it meant we all got to try things we wouldn't usually order. Mains wise, you really can't go wrong. The beef and tuna steaks are both juicy and delicious. The pasta's are a solid classic - you can't call yourself Italian and not serve a good ol' aldente pasta, am I right? If you are looking for a few nibbles and drinks, the bar is ace. The bartender knows how to make some great classic cocktails. I find the sign of a good bar is one that can make a proper whiskey sour - for the record, I am not easy to please in this department but they passed with flying colors (and no, that's not the whiskey talking). All in all, I was really impressed. Good energy, excellent food, and great times. I'll definitely be going back. P.s. the soundtrack was great as well! Odd thing to notice but terrible soundtracks drive me crazy. It's not at all loud so that you can't chat or get distracted by it but it's just loud enough where if you would like to stop and appreciate a classic tune no one would blame you. It's the cherry on top of the gelato sundae really.
480: Review: Stumbled on here, debating whether the giant fish in the window was real or not. Thankfully the very knowledgeable staff explained it was and how they prepared it. We ended up having two fish and two meat dishes, which were incredibly tasty and the staff were attentive and engaging. Definitely going back!
